commit_message:
Restore shelved instance original state

When nova unshelve an instance, it ignores the original state
of the instance before it's shelved. However, nova allow
paused, suspended, active and stopped instance to be shelved.
So this patch handles the SHELVED state instance return to its
original state when unshelve.

Change-Id: I54ee30d1ae16c7766ebdcb2bde500feddd17f150
Partial-Bug: #1360987

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-04-29 09:10:38.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Nova can stop instance when Fake/Actual compute driver used

When nova fake compute driver tries to stop instance, then vm_status
going to shutdown but power_state still in running state only.
I modify the code in nova/compute/manager.py in stop_instance()
method to go power_state to Shutdown state if someone uses fake
compute driver in /etc/nova/nova.conf. Also, code modification
not giving problem when actual driver was used.

Closes Bug: 1329192
Change-Id: I378d7357e9686c5b61580f205cf726f2e7c903f2
'}]
commit_message:
Nova can stop instance when Fake/Actual compute driver used

When nova fake compute driver tries to stop instance, then vm_status
going to shutdown but power_state still in running state only.
I modify the code in nova/compute/manager.py in stop_instance()
method to go power_state to Shutdown state if someone uses fake
compute driver in /etc/nova/nova.conf. Also, code modification
not giving problem when actual driver was used.

Closes Bug: 1329192
Change-Id: I378d7357e9686c5b61580f205cf726f2e7c903f2

revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2015-04-01 14:36:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/scheduler/filters/test_disk_filters.py', 'nova/scheduler/filters/disk_filter.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/block_device.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': 'Store user-requested ephemeral size in instance object

Instance flavor specifies maximum (and default) ephemeral size.  User is
able to specify smaller ephemeral size when running instance, but
DiskFilter uses ephemeral_gb value from instance_type, which sometimes
creates false-negative result.  Later, on compute node, resource tracker
uses instance.ephemeral_gb value to claim resources and may receive
false-negative answer.

Store user-requested ephemeral size as instance.ephemeral_gb and make
DiskFilter use this value instead of instance_type.ephemeral_gb.  This
behavior corresponds with current documentation[1].

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/user-guide/content/attach-disk-to-instance.html

Closes-Bug: #1428176

Change-Id: I369dce1c5ac46eac2aa944728edeeeb23214053a
'}]
commit_message:
Store user-requested ephemeral size in instance object

Instance flavor specifies maximum (and default) ephemeral size.  User is
able to specify smaller ephemeral size when running instance, but
DiskFilter uses ephemeral_gb value from instance_type, which sometimes
creates false-negative result.  Later, on compute node, resource tracker
uses instance.ephemeral_gb value to claim resources and may receive
false-negative answer.

Store user-requested ephemeral size as instance.ephemeral_gb and make
DiskFilter use this value instead of instance_type.ephemeral_gb.  This
behavior corresponds with current documentation[1].

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/user-guide/content/attach-disk-to-instance.html

Closes-Bug: #1428176

Change-Id: I369dce1c5ac46eac2aa944728edeeeb23214053a

commit_message:
Project quota update should not be less than user quota.

This patch implements changes to calculate user quota
and based on the total update the project quota to ensure
that project quota is not less than user quota.
Changes:
1. Lines of code to calculate user quota for a project.
2. To update the project quota,check the user quota and
ensure that project quota is not less than user quota.

Change-Id: I7bbef8f1b0f73a20a9edb5f0d1a38cfdc7bdf103
closes-bug: #1306229

commit_message:
Ironic: Extra configdrive metadata from Nodes

Make the Nova Ironic driver inject metadata from the Ironic node to the
configdrive, it's important to note that these metadata are added by the
deployer to do some extra configuration in the baremetal node if needed.

Change-Id: I3b00914a939d92f81787ac13f5bbb0c33bb6c50c

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-04-21 11:57:22.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_instance_group.py', 'nova/objects/instance_group.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Fix race in server group policy validation

There is a race condition when validating instances being
simultaneously created as part of the same server group.

It's possible to create two instances simultaneously, have them be
scheduled to hosts that would violate the group policy, have both
of them detect the problem in _validate_instance_group_policy(),
both of them get sent back for rescheduling, and both of them get
assigned to conflicting hosts *again*, resulting in an error.

The fix is to modify the validation code to ignore
group members created after the instance being validated.  This
ensures that at least one of the instances will run on the chosen
host, and the other will reschedule and adapt to the first.

Partial-Bug: #1423648
Change-Id: I9c890f08c57ec0994130838ff9d89a77fcac7ac5
"}]
commit_message:
Fix race in server group policy validation

There is a race condition when validating instances being
simultaneously created as part of the same server group.

It's possible to create two instances simultaneously, have them be
scheduled to hosts that would violate the group policy, have both
of them detect the problem in _validate_instance_group_policy(),
both of them get sent back for rescheduling, and both of them get
assigned to conflicting hosts *again*, resulting in an error.

The fix is to modify the validation code to ignore
group members created after the instance being validated.  This
ensures that at least one of the instances will run on the chosen
host, and the other will reschedule and adapt to the first.

Partial-Bug: #1423648
Change-Id: I9c890f08c57ec0994130838ff9d89a77fcac7ac5

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-03-12 20:18:17.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py'], 'message': "db: Don't compare datetime.datetime at > 1 second resolution

Several tests were expecting datetime fields to have microsecond
resolution as returns by timeutils, which they do in SQLite, but not
in MySQL. This change truncates all times in tests to 1 second
resolution so that they work on all currently supported database
backends.

Change-Id: Icc20b3406485301ab1bbf9669db51041a5bdce63
"}]
commit_message:
db: Don't compare datetime.datetime at > 1 second resolution

Several tests were expecting datetime fields to have microsecond
resolution as returns by timeutils, which they do in SQLite, but not
in MySQL. This change truncates all times in tests to 1 second
resolution so that they work on all currently supported database
backends.

Change-Id: Icc20b3406485301ab1bbf9669db51041a5bdce63

commit_message:
VMware: Add option to ignore the vswitch validation

In the existing VMware environment, we can not assume the port group on
all the ESXi hosts in cluster has the same vSwitch/pNIC mapping, so we
need provide an option to skip the associated vSwitch and physical
adapter mapping validate.

DocImpact
New option: ignore_vswitch_validation, default is False, if True then do
not check if the port group and vlan interface are associated on the
same virtual switch

Partial-Bug: #1337214
Change-Id: I7f0e52ba42405506ba57a19df792a8d40d1d85a8

commit_message:
Project quota update should not be less than user quota.

This patch implements changes to calculate user quota
and based on the total update the project quota to ensure
that project quota is not less than user quota.

Changes:

1. Lines of code to calculate user quota for a project.
2. To update the project quota,check the user quota and
ensure that project quota is not less than user quota.

Change-Id: I7c81d4488d5850772aa2bc8103c9af0a496dc283
closes-bug: #1306229

commit_message:
Refactor os-services endpoint

os-services changed to follow the convetion seen on other endpoint
 - getting the endpoint returns a list of IDs
 - getting an ID returns details
 - enabling/disabling is now posting an action to a given ID

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1217026
Change-Id: I59d0030ac9ae650aed7126c36a377bd77887341a

commit_message:
midonet: add midonet type driver

Add a midonet type driver. This type driver is useful for differentiating
midonet networks from others when using midonet as a mechanism driver
with the ML2 plugin.

Closes-Bug: #1481595
Signed-off-by: Joe Mills <joe@midokura.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ryu Ishimoto <ryu@midokura.com>

Change-Id: I4f5f38571c7aeb2c15477725cd9bb6e066d71dbf

Fix bug in function get_instance_availability_zone

This is to fix the bug that the "if not host:" never holds in
function get_instance_availability_zone() of module
nova.availability_zones in case host is None.
This is because str(None) is never interpreted False.

Change-Id: I43f516189181ff4acadb7cf08d0c1c4503dee92d
Closes-Bug: #1414556

commit_message:
Update the documentation to use IPA as deploy ramdisk

This patch adds a section about creating a deploy ramdisk with IPA
instead of the bash ramdisk and also update the driver specific
documentations to point to it when creating a deploy image.

Implements: blueprint deprecate-bash-ramdisk
Change-Id: Id9d86cafc35efdbec2d53b7c956a94d39f205e41

commit_message:
Add rpc client side version control for conductor task API

The rpc client side version control is used for rolling upgrade.
This patch adds control for conductor task API, althrough there isn't
any change for task rpc API in Kilo, but it may be changed in the future.

Change-Id: Ic34585def83e1e14590ecc6d07ffa07092aad492
Closes-Bug: #1444747

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7166, 'name': 'Sylvain Bauza', 'email': 'sbauza@redhat.com', 'username': 'sbauza'}, {'_account_id': 7221, 'name': 'Jennifer Mulsow', 'email': 'jmulsow@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'jmulsow'}, {'_account_id': 8768, 'name': 'Chris Friesen', 'email': 'chris.friesen@windriver.com', 'username': 'cbf123'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12299, 'name': 'Paweł Koniszewski', 'email': 'pawel.koniszewski@gmail.com', 'username': 'pawel.koniszewski'}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-04-21 11:57:34.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_instance_group.py', 'nova/objects/instance_group.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Fix race in affinity server group scheduling

Jennifer Mulsow pointed out another race condition when scheduling
multiple instances in an "affinity" servergroup.  It goes like this:

Suppose 3 VMs are created into an empty affinity group nearly
simultaneously. VM1 gets scheduled to Host1, and VM2 and VM3 get
scheduled to Host2. Assuming VM1 was created first and VM3 was
created last, we would expect VM2 to fail group policy validation
and reschedule.  However, when VM3 does the group policy validation
there will be 2 VM members older than it. VM1 on Host1, and VM2 on
Host2. VM3 is on Host2, so the condition

"if group_hosts and self.host not in group hosts".

tests as "false", which means VM3 wouldn't be rescheduled, which
would result in VMs in the affinity group being deployed to both
Host1 and Host2.

The fix is to add another method to the InstanceGroup class which
returns the host of the earliest-created instance in the group and
use that when validating the "affinity" policy.

Change-Id: I369a243342c4f059cc6c7c9257ea2d93210b0a45
Closes-Bug: #1423648
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race in affinity server group scheduling

Jennifer Mulsow pointed out another race condition when scheduling
multiple instances in an "affinity" servergroup.  It goes like this:

Suppose 3 VMs are created into an empty affinity group nearly
simultaneously. VM1 gets scheduled to Host1, and VM2 and VM3 get
scheduled to Host2. Assuming VM1 was created first and VM3 was
created last, we would expect VM2 to fail group policy validation
and reschedule.  However, when VM3 does the group policy validation
there will be 2 VM members older than it. VM1 on Host1, and VM2 on
Host2. VM3 is on Host2, so the condition

"if group_hosts and self.host not in group hosts".

tests as "false", which means VM3 wouldn't be rescheduled, which
would result in VMs in the affinity group being deployed to both
Host1 and Host2.

The fix is to add another method to the InstanceGroup class which
returns the host of the earliest-created instance in the group and
use that when validating the "affinity" policy.

Change-Id: I369a243342c4f059cc6c7c9257ea2d93210b0a45
Closes-Bug: #1423648

commit_message:
Fix service parameter default value of send_update()

The default value of service parameter send_update() is None now.
It will override its subroutine's default value, so that publisher
id prefix in message may become 'None'. Need to use 'compute' as
its default value.

Change-Id: Ic1c51554d973094f9b062c4fbb3c1e66c61a8821

commit_message:
Move glance client ssl option to glance group

Ssl parameter of each client used by Nova need to have separated
config options. Now the ssl options of glance client are located in
ssl group. Need to move them to glance group.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ibdbc57ad03eb0a2a711a3e43584adae9462325d5

'}]
commit_message:
Fix the bug that the size of volume isn't consistent with flavor

When we launch a instance using "boot from image" option
and the image is the snapshot of a volume-backed instance,
we do not have the interface in dashboard or command-line to
input the size of the volume. Finally, we will get a
volume-backed instance and the size of its volume equals
the size of snapshot.

In this patch, we make the size of the volume equals the size
defined in flavor instead of the size of snapshot in such
situation.

Closes-Bug: #1380493
Change-Id: I78a3dca77937a54a2227db65ea0d0982152e1bf9

Nova will delete all backup images according the 'backup_type' parameter
when 'rotation' equals to 0.

But according the logic now, Nova will generate one new backup, and then
delete it. So It's weird to snapshot a useless backup firstly.

We need to add one new branch here:
if 'rotation' is equal to 0, no need to backup, just rotate it.

commit_message:
No need to backup instance when 'rotation' == 0

Nova will delete all backup images according the 'backup_type' parameter
when 'rotation' equals to 0.

But according the logic now, Nova will generate one new backup, and then
delete it. So It's weird to snapshot a useless backup firstly.

We need to add one new branch here:
if 'rotation' is equal to 0, no need to backup, just rotate it.

Change-Id: I10d8adde79cdcd5cf66411dac955745d06d5ceb5
Closes-Bug: #1334923

commit_message:
Disallow hard reboot for suspended instances

Suspend is exposed in the admin_actions API extension and it is likely
that a deployer will have their policy configured so that suspend/resume
are admin only.  So we should disallow switching from SUSPEND to ACTIVE
via reboot and have a user resume before rebooting.

Change-Id: I92b30aa97df6ac1b72ad668a262a5d5f26b5fc15

commit_message:
Libvirt: Add support for storage XML to config

This commit adds support to the libvirt driver's config
file for parsing and serializing libvirt storage pool
and storage volume information.

Implements bp: use-libvirt-storage-pools

Change-Id: Ief680c22ff10b6c25930d6cba118146114ab7d0f

commit_message:
VFS: Fix test patching oslo.utils.import_module

`oslo.utils.import_module` is called
`oslo.utils.importutils.importmodule`.  This was causing the affect
test in 'nova/tests/unit/virt/disk/test_api.py' not not function
correctly.  This is now fixed.

Change-Id: Ie68bec10fcdfbd67ab53959a8b8d157e802c7a53

Currently the HyperV Driver ignores the CHAP credentials

For this reason, attach volume fails if CHAP is enforced

commit_message:
HyperV - Fix attach volume with CHAP.

Currently the HyperV Driver ignores the CHAP credentials
while adding the Target Portal to the host.
For this reason, attach volume fails if CHAP is enforced
on HP LeftHand and HP 3Par backends.
This patch allows for attaching volumes which are created
with CHAP enabled on on HP LeftHand and HP 3Par backends.
The changes are done for both V1 and V2 storage API for Windows.

Change-Id: I0b3aa603502b76a262666039e7b347e2f38241b1
Closes-Bug: #1403836

[{'number': 26, 'created': '2014-12-27 10:52:27.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/ec2/cloud.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/ec2/test_cloud.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/ec2/test_ec2_validate.py', 'nova/api/ec2/ec2utils.py'], 'message': "EC2: Reorganize code for EC2 tags

This change makes the EC2 tags' code more generic, so that
tags for new resources can be added easily.

DocImpact: When an invalid EC2 instance ID was supplied, e.g. 'abcd',
    instead of a valid one like 'i-12345678', the DescribeTags API
    used to throw InstanceNotFound (HTTP 404). This has been changed
    to InvalidEc2Id (HTTP 400) after this change. This is a valid
    change as it is EC2 API (doesn't have different HTTP status
    codes), and we are correcting our previous EC2 API behavior to
    match with the upstream Amazon EC2 API behavior.

Progress on:
Blueprint: ec2-volume-and-snapshot-tags
Change-Id: Iba774d55c84dbbef57c56cd331b3ffcd7e41f3ec
"}]
commit_message:
EC2: Reorganize code for EC2 tags

This change makes the EC2 tags' code more generic, so that
tags for new resources can be added easily.

DocImpact: When an invalid EC2 instance ID was supplied, e.g. 'abcd',
    instead of a valid one like 'i-12345678', the DescribeTags API
    used to throw InstanceNotFound (HTTP 404). This has been changed
    to InvalidEc2Id (HTTP 400) after this change. This is a valid
    change as it is EC2 API (doesn't have different HTTP status
    codes), and we are correcting our previous EC2 API behavior to
    match with the upstream Amazon EC2 API behavior.

Progress on:
Blueprint: ec2-volume-and-snapshot-tags
Change-Id: Iba774d55c84dbbef57c56cd331b3ffcd7e41f3ec

commit_message:
Fix the inconsistent info of availability zone

If the default availability zone is replaced with the
newly-created one, then it causes the info of availability
zone to be inconsistent for every retrieval in the process
of launching new VM instance.

This bug fix will not work if the availability zone is not
specified (e.g. via CLI of nova boot).

Change-Id: I50d3515f94a37cb564ca26b9ef667e3a3cfd2b62
Closes-Bug: #1390033

This change is to support the v2 and v3 /servers and /servers/detail
APIs to support providing previous page links in server_links.

This patch set contains utility functions to:
* Reverse the sort directions when is_reverse is True
* Reverse the instance list when is_reverse is True
* Add previous page links using marker of the first item and is_reverse

The idea of this change is to get the previous page of servers by searching
from the first item in the reverse direction. And the final result should
also be reversed to keep up the actual direction. A new 'is_reverse' param
is added to determine whether to reverse the sort directions or not.

Change-Id: I9dbcf9f969cc0e3329c218179b1643dcc5d22783
Implements: blueprint nova-pagination-prevpage
"}]
commit_message:
Add previous page links for Nova GET servers API

This change is to support the v2 and v3 /servers and /servers/detail
APIs to support providing previous page links in server_links.

This patch set contains utility functions to:
* Reverse the sort directions when is_reverse is True
* Reverse the instance list when is_reverse is True
* Add previous page links using marker of the first item and is_reverse

The idea of this change is to get the previous page of servers by searching
from the first item in the reverse direction. And the final result should
also be reversed to keep up the actual direction. A new 'is_reverse' param
is added to determine whether to reverse the sort directions or not.

Change-Id: I9dbcf9f969cc0e3329c218179b1643dcc5d22783
Implements: blueprint nova-pagination-prevpage

commit_message:
VMware: Attach iSCSI volume support CHAP authentication

Currently, VMware driver use the "Dynamic Discovery" to discover the
targets, and can't support to add the CHAP authentication info to a
target. But by default, the 'lioadm' iscsi helper will enable the
authentication attribute to each volume.

This patch create a static target with auth info for host to make sure
the host has authority to connect to the target.

Change-Id: I2403993e8365ee58d588fb64484bb94b1cb609ea
Closes-bug: #1437993

[{'number': 25, 'created': '2015-04-19 02:07:44.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/volumeops.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_driver_api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/vmwareapi/test_volumeops.py'], 'message': "Vmware:Fix how VolumeOps is getting host information

In order to attach iscsi disk to a VM, first, it need to
get iscsi information such as hba and iscsi topology from
that host where the VM resides. So when an instance is
specified, use get_host_ref_for_vm instead of
get_host_ref which simply returns the first host in
the managed cluster. get_host_ref is still used to get the
first host in the cluster if no instance is specified.

DocImpact

Limitations:
1. you wouldn't be able to vMotion it.
2. you wouldn't be able to take the corresponding host down for
maintenance without shutting down all instances running on it.
3. you wouldn't be able to migrate the instance until you detached
all iscsi devices.

Change-Id: I8e2b9725b9e99931731a9b1e52d799dca43bae74
Closes-Bug: #1386975
"}]
commit_message:
Vmware:Fix how VolumeOps is getting host information

In order to attach iscsi disk to a VM, first, it need to
get iscsi information such as hba and iscsi topology from
that host where the VM resides. So when an instance is
specified, use get_host_ref_for_vm instead of
get_host_ref which simply returns the first host in
the managed cluster. get_host_ref is still used to get the
first host in the cluster if no instance is specified.

DocImpact

Limitations:
1. you wouldn't be able to vMotion it.
2. you wouldn't be able to take the corresponding host down for
maintenance without shutting down all instances running on it.
3. you wouldn't be able to migrate the instance until you detached
all iscsi devices.

Change-Id: I8e2b9725b9e99931731a9b1e52d799dca43bae74
Closes-Bug: #1386975

commit_message:
Recover instance state after nova-compute failure during spawn

If nova-compute stopped while an instance was spawning, check if it's running
during startup. In case it was fully spawned, set the proper states.

Change-Id: Ie0d4dd3293e54fdd91210c53d08f90e1bc045553
Closes-Bug: 1072734

commit_message:
Fix the inconsistent info of availability zone

If the default availability zone is replaced with the
newly-created one, then it causes the info of availability
zone to be inconsistent for every retrieval in the process
of launching new VM instance.

This bug fix will not work if the availability zone is not
specified (e.g. via CLI of nova boot).

Change-Id: I025c5f9db7963c91803ba9417133b99f9b3d81ca
Closes-Bug: #1390033

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-12 00:50:59.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/type/glance_image.rb'], 'message': 'Append openstacklib/lib to load path for type

As we discovered before[1] with puppet-keystone, rspec-puppet has
trouble loading paths in some circumstances. This patch updates the

in other modules can properly load the openstacklib backend.

Change-Id: Ifa3cbd46b8b32695848d4c2e8f837881c46a7d98

commit_message:
Append openstacklib/lib to load path for type

As we discovered before[1] with puppet-keystone, rspec-puppet has
trouble loading paths in some circumstances. This patch updates the
$LOAD_PATH in the newly rewritten glance_image type so that unit tests
in other modules can properly load the openstacklib backend.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/puppet-keystone/+bug/1408531

Change-Id: Ifa3cbd46b8b32695848d4c2e8f837881c46a7d98

commit_message:
Remove service_type requirement from catalog searching

The standard reason to search the catalog is that you want to know how
to find a particular service type. However with service_id and
endpoint_id you may not want to specify a service_type.

Allow searching for a url without specifying a service_type.

Change-Id: I038fe5b0e04b689f1072db659219639d5193f558

commit_message:
Move common request processing to base class

Move the standard parts of token validation onto the base class. To make
this work in a way that is useful for both keystone and auth_token we
need to fetch and validate the tokens and then enforce what to do with
the request at a higher level.

Change-Id: I01ec6798b6c029c0013f4bcf73697c92a3063f4b

Policy support

Zaqar needs to support policy. This proposal is for adding
policy.json and leveraging olso.policy to implement fine-grained
permissions for Zaqar's Rest API endpoints.

blueprint: fine-grained-permissions

commit_message:
Clean up test_dvr_router_rem_fips_on_restarted_agent

* self._add_fip wasn't actually doing anything useful, it just
  throws off the reader by making him/her think that line is
  important when it isn't.
* Added an assertion that checks that the FIP namespace exists
  before the reconfiguration of the router.

Change-Id: Ifd27f20d9d8d11575212b95e3bbe534bfe2d3b8f

revisions:
[{'number': 17, 'created': '2015-06-14 11:58:42.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/test_service.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_wsgi.py', 'nova/openstack/common/service.py', 'nova/wsgi.py'], 'message': 'WIP: Graceful shutdown WSGI server

Currently, killing a nova-api will immediately stop WSGI service which
interrupts in-process request. This will cause problem when do upgrading.
The patch do two thing:

On master process side, stopping server (close socket) before sends
KILL signal to children process. Because if master still open the socket,
user can successfully connects to API server but gets no response.

On children process side, closing socket first, then waits for all greenlets
to finish, finally exits it self.

DocImpact: graceful termination of process is not instantaneous.
To force instantaneous termination second SIGTERM signal must be sent.

Change-Id: I2b529654f272c23e346fab13b0d7fa596c86ef13
Closes-bug: #1382390
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Graceful shutdown WSGI server

Currently, killing a nova-api will immediately stop WSGI service which
interrupts in-process request. This will cause problem when do upgrading.
The patch do two thing:

On master process side, stopping server (close socket) before sends
KILL signal to children process. Because if master still open the socket,
user can successfully connects to API server but gets no response.

On children process side, closing socket first, then waits for all greenlets
to finish, finally exits it self.

DocImpact: graceful termination of process is not instantaneous.
To force instantaneous termination second SIGTERM signal must be sent.

Change-Id: I2b529654f272c23e346fab13b0d7fa596c86ef13
Closes-bug: #1382390

subject: Improve simple-tenant-usage API performance
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9555, 'name': 'Matthew Booth', 'email': 'mbooth@redhat.com', 'username': 'MatthewBooth'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10485, 'name': 'Ankit Agrawal', 'email': 'ankitagrawal8188@gmail.com', 'username': 'ankitagrawal'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-25 10:20:28.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/simple_tenant_usage.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_simple_tenant_usage.py', 'nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/simple_tenant_usage.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Improve simple-tenant-usage API performance

When simple-tenant-usage API is invoked for a particular tenant owning
large number of instances (both active & terminated), it takes long time
due to a SQL retrieving large number of records of
instance_system_metadata for instances using where in clause.

Removed system_metadata used for expected_attrs in simple-tenant-usage
API as it was only used to get flavor. Get flavor info by
instance_type_id stored in instance table instead of system_metadata.

This change improves simple-tenant-usage API performance by approx.
50 percentage. Earlier nova usage command for 13844 instances was
taking 25.778 seconds which is improved to an average of 11.496 seconds
with this change.

Closes-Bug: 1367944
Closes-Bug: 1421471
Change-Id: Ibed4212df0e29598d98071b8f00cb0dbcbedcabc
'}]
commit_message:
Improve simple-tenant-usage API performance

When simple-tenant-usage API is invoked for a particular tenant owning
large number of instances (both active & terminated), it takes long time
due to a SQL retrieving large number of records of
instance_system_metadata for instances using where in clause.

Removed system_metadata used for expected_attrs in simple-tenant-usage
API as it was only used to get flavor. Get flavor info by
instance_type_id stored in instance table instead of system_metadata.

This change improves simple-tenant-usage API performance by approx.
50 percentage. Earlier nova usage command for 13844 instances was
taking 25.778 seconds which is improved to an average of 11.496 seconds
with this change.

Closes-Bug: 1367944
Closes-Bug: 1421471
Change-Id: Ibed4212df0e29598d98071b8f00cb0dbcbedcabc

Services can be disabled by several reasons and admins can use the API to
specify a reason. However, currently if new services are added and
"enable_new_services=False" there is no disable reason specified.
Having services disabled with no reason specified creates additional checks on
the operators side that increases with the deployment size.

This patch specifies the disable reason "New Service" when a new service is
added and "enable_new_services=False".

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1417027

Change-Id: I3d3866e412dc1e251488b57dc0b541b34fb319f6
'}]
commit_message:
No disable reason defined for new services

Services can be disabled by several reasons and admins can use the API to
specify a reason. However, currently if new services are added and
"enable_new_services=False" there is no disable reason specified.
Having services disabled with no reason specified creates additional checks on
the operators side that increases with the deployment size.

This patch specifies the disable reason "New Service" when a new service is
added and "enable_new_services=False".

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1417027

Change-Id: I3d3866e412dc1e251488b57dc0b541b34fb319f6

commit_message:
Skip detach when volume is no longer in-use

Detaching a volume which is not attached in cinder will return
a 500 error which prevents the nova-compute terminating the
instance.

This commit simply checks the status of the volume before
detaching it.

Change-Id: I6f529e5387f31a3cca549e6247a0195ac0e7bf6a

commit_message:
libvirt: Proxy RBD library call into a separate thread

If RBD is slow/down, calls to it can hang the thread,
resulting in problems like AMQP timeouts after a few minutes.

Proxy the calls into a separate eventlet thread so that other
operations can still be handled.  This approach was recently
used in Cinder, as well.

Related-Bug: #1401335
Closes-Bug: #1451891

Change-Id: I8674781fff958fd13e088afe2728bf22c585f9e1

commit_message:
Correct az property of instance when specifying force host/node

Currently, the server creation will succeed when specifying force_host
with an invalid availibility zone name, but which will cause failure
when subsequent action(e.g. resize) is performed.

This patch fix this problem by correcting the availability_zone property
in case of specifying invalid az when booting instance with force host. At
the same time, use CONF.default_schedule_zone if user specifies force host
or force node.

Closes-Bug: #1431194
Change-Id: I7fe25f29f6170bff2920508bbbefa208a8308495

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-03 10:17:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/conductor/manager.py', 'nova/conductor/tasks/live_migrate.py'], 'message': 'Add INFO logging to successful schedules

Following the Ops midcycle, a common raised problem is
that the scheduler is not explicitely mentioning in the logs
which instance failed or successfully booted. Here, adding the
INFO logs when the instance has successfully been scheduled.
As the scheduler is not knowing the list of instance UUIDs
(only the one from the first instance given in instance_props),
we need to provide that INFO log in the conductor once
select_destinations is returning a list of hosts.

Change-Id: I275e7709b5052a33305590191ac978a17010021c
'}]
commit_message:
Add INFO logging to successful schedules

Following the Ops midcycle, a common raised problem is
that the scheduler is not explicitely mentioning in the logs
which instance failed or successfully booted. Here, adding the
INFO logs when the instance has successfully been scheduled.
As the scheduler is not knowing the list of instance UUIDs
(only the one from the first instance given in instance_props),
we need to provide that INFO log in the conductor once
select_destinations is returning a list of hosts.

NOTE : It needs a StringFreeze exception to merge that patch
for Kilo.

Related-Bug: #1431291

commit_message:
Skip unit tests for SSL + py3

When we request something from SSL wrapped app using py3 and we do not get
answer at all. In case of unit tests we face test timeout.
So, skip these tests until related b_u_g is fixed.

Change-Id: I809668e5c04b7ace45291e3d1bfd743853f55918
Related-Bug: #1482633
Partially-Implements: bp py3-compatibility

commit_message:
Add Midonet ML2 Mechanism/Type Driver

Add a mechanism and type drivers that implement midonet API calls and
are configurable with the ML2 plugin.

Summary of changes:

 * New ML2 type driver for midonet
 * New ML2 mechanism driver for midonet
 * New ML2 SG callback handler for midonet
 * Devstack configurations to set up ML2 with midonet drivers
 * Entry points for the midonet ML2 drivers
 * local.conf sample files both midonet and ml2 plugins
 * README update for ML2

Partially Implements: bp/midonet-ml2
Signed-off-by: Joe Mills <joe@midokura.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ryu Ishimoto <ryu@midokura.com>

Change-Id: I0b0ce33edb108131e71f7a3307660810b55dbcf4

commit_message:
Add coordination feature to mistral service

Add mistrai-api, mistral-engine, mistral-executor services to their
service group respectively when they start up, so that we can retrieve
their information through service api which will be implemented in
subsequent patch.

Change-Id: Ibfcc17b35b9d2e408888b7d1cb64e63f2b32a90d
Partially-Implements: blueprint mistral-service-api

commit_message:
Use correct library versions for py33

Some libraries are not directly compatible with py33
Thus, we need to install their py33 versions while
using py33

Change-Id: I404d09ae2e6252e120da3d09591562799013ff42
Closes-Bug: #1378537

The force_delete method of nova/compute/cells_api module is actually
not needed, as this method handle objects and is triggered when
force-delete api is used for instance deletion in cells environment.

It actually causes a race condition with instance deletion as it
triggers 2 instance deletion from a compute cell for single
force-delete request.

Modified delete-api implementation so that force-delete request
triggers single instance deletion call in cells environment.

Change-Id: I812f27761fc4d4f64563d79f793c484d03aa641f
Closes-Bug: #1381425
'}]
commit_message:
Remove cell api overrides for force-delete

The force_delete method of nova/compute/cells_api module is actually
not needed, as this method handle objects and is triggered when
force-delete api is used for instance deletion in cells environment.

It actually causes a race condition with instance deletion as it
triggers 2 instance deletion from a compute cell for single
force-delete request.

Modified delete-api implementation so that force-delete request
triggers single instance deletion call in cells environment.

Change-Id: I812f27761fc4d4f64563d79f793c484d03aa641f
Closes-Bug: #1381425

One of the issues raised with keystoneclient plugins is the way that
loading of a plugin is mixed in with the definition of a plugin. Amongst
other things this really meant that there was only one way to utilize
each plugin class, to do another plugin that utilized an existing one
you would have to define a new class and proxy to it.

In this patch we split the concerns. There is a whole new section called
loading that is solely responsible for ways to load the auth plugin from
CLI or from argparse and other future methods.

This new section will likely be split into its own repository.

Change-Id: I8387b86fc0e3a8403f9806440196e8723eaf1ee4
'}]
commit_message:
Split plugin loading

One of the issues raised with keystoneclient plugins is the way that
loading of a plugin is mixed in with the definition of a plugin. Amongst
other things this really meant that there was only one way to utilize
each plugin class, to do another plugin that utilized an existing one
you would have to define a new class and proxy to it.

In this patch we split the concerns. There is a whole new section called
loading that is solely responsible for ways to load the auth plugin from
CLI or from argparse and other future methods.

This new section will likely be split into its own repository.

Change-Id: I8387b86fc0e3a8403f9806440196e8723eaf1ee4

commit_message:
Improve logging and prepare for gate

Switched all print statements to use logger

Added ability to halt operations via Ctrl-C, needs cleanup handler

Added realtime logging when using only one thread (matches bash building
scripts behavior)

main is now returning all the build image statuses, so a quick test
script would look like:

import build
res = build.main()
if len(res[0]):
    LOG.error('failure')

Change-Id: Ic8000a96573b011490dc330a4512c77c602ac3d2
Partially-Implements: blueprint build-script

commit_message:
SR-IOV: Convert max rate from kbps to Mbps

ip link tool configures max rate in Mbps and
it the QoS model max rate is defined in kbps. This
patch convert the max rate from kbps to Mbps. Also
because zero disables the rate limit the min value
is 1Mbps and not 1kbps.

DocImpact
Partially-Implements: blueprint ml2-sriov-qos-with-bwlimiting
Change-Id: I91b08c5d8ccaa2867b6eafd0c86872f401dd04c8

commit_message:
drop neutron_plugin_ovs type/provider

In Kilo, we removed Neutron OVS plugin because it was dropped in Juno in
favor of using ML2 plugin.

We missed to drop the neutron_plugin_ovs type/provider in the patch and
this is what this patch aims about.

Change-Id: Ic9addc51de43ec67db4835072be61e1306281611

midonet: define reference to midonet mech driver

Introduces a reference to the midonet ml2 mechanism driver,
and a corresponding directory.

Partially-Implements:

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/networking-midonet/+spec/midonet-ml2

Change-Id: I37bc6e591d9c046602f32bbf3973e831242f75ec
Closes-bug: #1474651
Signed-off-by: Joe Mills <joe@midokura.com>

commit_message:
Disable optional authentication for plugin

Rework the tests to extract a mock fixture that is capable of mocking
server authenticated requests. Set the plugin to mutual authentication
by default.

Closes-Bug: #1482468
Change-Id: I06daea59d25cd63c552f2db9f663bbc33e659ed5

This commit adds 2 new jobs for using tempest's test accounts
mechanism. This is an alternate tempest configuration which enables
using a static set of multiple credentials which provide isolation
between tests instead of dynamically creating them. This configuration
is eventually going to replace the traditional config options for
credentials but before we can deprecate the old options we need to
have bit rot jobs setup to make sure we don't break this feature.

Change-Id: I58b68d422ee4aeee8e4e143a9e257bb6e6b9214f
Depends-On: I8682f72ffe26fd133874f5c575df6389f787ffcc
"}]
commit_message:
Add periodic/experimental tempest job for using test accounts

This commit adds 2 new jobs for using tempest's test accounts
mechanism. This is an alternate tempest configuration which enables
using a static set of multiple credentials which provide isolation
between tests instead of dynamically creating them. This configuration
is eventually going to replace the traditional config options for
credentials but before we can deprecate the old options we need to
have bit rot jobs setup to make sure we don't break this feature.

Change-Id: I58b68d422ee4aeee8e4e143a9e257bb6e6b9214f
Depends-On: I8682f72ffe26fd133874f5c575df6389f787ffcc

commit_message:
Stop doing any magic cloning of neutron during CI

Hopefully this will allow the Zuul "Depends-On" thing to work better.

Adopting the solution developed by Doug Wiegley for LBaaS:
c61f920f2a54fd829ee37484b3743ab77b909847

Change-Id: Id3f716b9f151dbb99cc02ddec00a841bea7ad463

commit_message:
Import oslo_messaging instead of oslo.messaging

This fixes the unit tests.

To get jenkins to pass we also need to comment out the migration
check for pep8 temporarily. This check will be re-enabled with
https://review.openstack.org/205866

Change-Id: If8484812e7cd026727b920fa70182db23154df58

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-04 17:40:25.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/brick/test_brick_connector.py', 'cinder/brick/initiator/connector.py'], 'message': 'Support host type specific block volume attachment

----
NOTE(markus_z): This is a "backport" of commit
b1a8c2e1f18d424adfdfa29bae47cafa4700dcee which is merged in os-brick.
That patch is marked as implementing a blueprint, but should have
been a bug in the first place. The blueprint support-hosttype-on-attach
shouldn't have been necessary.
----

Add the platform and operating system type to the connector to allow a
Cinder driver to set host type specific configuration attributes when
attaching a Fibre-Channel volume.

Closes-Bug: #1471810

Change-Id: I2eef20b46808a49a330c64d517ad6430392674fd
'}]
commit_message:
Support host type specific block volume attachment

----
NOTE(markus_z): This is a "backport" of commit
b1a8c2e1f18d424adfdfa29bae47cafa4700dcee which is merged in os-brick.
That patch is marked as implementing a blueprint, but should have
been a bug in the first place. The blueprint support-hosttype-on-attach
shouldn't have been necessary.
----

Add the platform and operating system type to the connector to allow a
Cinder driver to set host type specific configuration attributes when
attaching a Fibre-Channel volume.

Closes-Bug: #1471810

Change-Id: I2eef20b46808a49a330c64d517ad6430392674fd

commit_message:
Allow searching a catalog on service or endpoint id

endpoint_id and service_id are parts of both the v2 and v3 tokens. We
should allow finding urls for them in the same way as other attributes.

Change-Id: I22b5f4bd44e9a493017de89e14a705699df24280

commit_message:
Add ability to specify number of workers for glance-registry service

Currently we haven't ability to specify number of workers for glance-registry.
So this patch implements this feature.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/kilo/config-reference/content/section_glance-registry.conf.html

Change-Id: I71eb22d2ad15cd9c9d50e3370a3867f7298b47ca

commit_message:
Add show_resource function to Mistral resources (4)

AWS resources will not be changed due to they do not support additional
attributes. So 'show' attribute will be presented in their schemas, but
will return always None.

This patch adds show_resource method for heat (mistral) resources:
 - workflow
 - cron trigger

Change-Id: I10599a0eb45c99acb44414147d04734e740afcf0

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-11 13:14:44.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/nailgun/manifests/auxiliaryrepos.pp', 'deployment/puppet/nailgun/examples/host-only.pp', 'deployment/puppet/nailgun/manifests/host.pp', 'deployment/puppet/nailgun/examples/host-upgrade.pp'], 'message': 'Create auxiliary repo with fuel version

Fuel 7.0 auxiliary repo should be created
as /etc/yum.repos.d/7.0_auxiliary

This helps with upgrade/rollback process for
Fuel Master.

The configuration for auxiliary repository on
deployed Fuel nodes is unchanged.

commit_message:
Create auxiliary repo with fuel version

Fuel 7.0 auxiliary repo should be created
as /etc/yum.repos.d/7.0_auxiliary

This helps with upgrade/rollback process for
Fuel Master.

The configuration for auxiliary repository on
deployed Fuel nodes is unchanged.

Change-Id: Iec2645ddbee6b1b6b9e5c2816707b275542ef51b
Partial-Bug: #1480282

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-08-11 15:22:00.000000000', 'files': ['tooz/tests/test_coordination.py', 'tooz/locking.py'], 'message': "Accept blocking argument in lock's context manager

This patch adds the posibility of passing the blocking argument to the
context manager to be used when acquiring the lock.

Previous behavior will be preserved, so now we will be able to use the
context manager in any of the following ways:

    with lock(10.0):
    with lock(False):
    with lock():
    with lock:

The last 2 are equivalent.

Change-Id: I6d2f486ac45078ec4ce77de52b7997f2122d4dc8
"}]
commit_message:
Accept blocking argument in lock's context manager

This patch adds the posibility of passing the blocking argument to the
context manager to be used when acquiring the lock.

Previous behavior will be preserved, so now we will be able to use the
context manager in any of the following ways:

    with lock(10.0):
    with lock(False):
    with lock():
    with lock:

The last 2 are equivalent.

Change-Id: I6d2f486ac45078ec4ce77de52b7997f2122d4dc8

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-05 14:53:37.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/agentschedulers_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/scheduler/test_dhcp_agent_scheduler.py'], 'message': 'Fix: Skip rescheduling networks if no DHCP agents available

This fixes commit 1318437a0caf38e695a819848832a955fef7d909
which has inaccurate check for dead agents: in a case where
there is only one network scheduled to a subset of dhcp agents,
number of all dhcp agents will be not equal to the number of
dead binded agents

The unit test is updated to cover the described case.

Closes-Bug: #1461714
Change-Id: I1c9501316c931293aa8ba755a98779a7da27578d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix: Skip rescheduling networks if no DHCP agents available

This fixes commit 1318437a0caf38e695a819848832a955fef7d909
which has inaccurate check for dead agents: in a case where
there is only one network scheduled to a subset of dhcp agents,
number of all dhcp agents will be not equal to the number of
dead binded agents

The unit test is updated to cover the described case.

Closes-Bug: #1461714
Change-Id: I1c9501316c931293aa8ba755a98779a7da27578d

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary trailing backslash in Installation Guide

This patch removes unnecessary trailing backslash from the command
line in Installation Guide so that user can copy and paste the command
line.

     ironic node-update $NODE_UUID add \
     driver_info/deploy_kernel=$DEPLOY_VMLINUZ_UUID \
-    driver_info/deploy_ramdisk=$DEPLOY_INITRD_UUID \
+    driver_info/deploy_ramdisk=$DEPLOY_INITRD_UUID

Change-Id: I96dfb580250e1bf3bb2a6b6b7470d87f56ee2553

commit_message:
Use openstack/ namespace for fixtures modules

When running the tests, rspec will download the modules speficied in
.fixtures.yml and put them in spec/fixtures/modules.

Some of those modules still point to stackforge/ namespace when they
should be pointing to openstack/ namespace.

Change-Id: I2ca55663ac4b57c6e12001edcd4d989421ad27a7

This method consumes Resource.list data and filters through it to match
regular expression patterns associated with attributes on the Resource,
returning a generator of any resources that match all of the queries
passed in. When no resources match, an empty generator is returned. When

commit_message:
Implement a generic find method

This method consumes Resource.list data and filters through it to match
regular expression patterns associated with attributes on the Resource,
returning a generator of any resources that match all of the queries
passed in. When no resources match, an empty generator is returned. When
a property is given that is not found on the resource, that is
considered a non-match.

Change-Id: I7a38dfc07a329d0b60f56b6e1a680a46bd9705be
Closes-Bug: 1466174

subject: Inspector inspection fails due to node locked error
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6618, 'name': 'Ruby Loo', 'email': 'opensrloo@gmail.com', 'username': 'rloo'}, {'_account_id': 9751, 'name': 'IBM DB2 CI', 'email': 'scecd@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibmdb2', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 14826, 'name': 'Mark Goddard', 'email': 'markgoddard86@gmail.com', 'username': 'mgoddard'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-08-11 13:16:34.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/inspector.py'], 'message': "Inspector inspection fails due to node locked error

This change solves an issue whereby inspection using ironic inspector
could fail due to a race condition between ironic and inspector. The
failure was caused by the ironic inspector driver's periodic task to
check the inspection status holding the node's lock during an API
request to inspector. This change only acquires the lock after the
API request has completed, when the inspection has finished or
failed.

Change-Id: If4c5f7d4addcaf6d53073b71cd4fdb71e2a3b2bd
Closes-bug: #1482646
"}]
commit_message:
Inspector inspection fails due to node locked error

This change solves an issue whereby inspection using ironic inspector
could fail due to a race condition between ironic and inspector. The
failure was caused by the ironic inspector driver's periodic task to
check the inspection status holding the node's lock during an API
request to inspector. This change only acquires the lock after the
API request has completed, when the inspection has finished or
failed.

Change-Id: If4c5f7d4addcaf6d53073b71cd4fdb71e2a3b2bd
Closes-bug: #1482646

commit_message:
Fix ordering issue related to swift.conf

The file /etc/swift/swift.conf is managed by puppet.
There is no ordering contraint between swift_config resource and the
/etc/swift/swift.conf file resource.

It causes randomly failure when the swift_config resource applies before
the file resource

Change-Id: I08803a68ede6e3659e93c342949d8bb4e823ccd9

Enacting the log link creation and the ansible.cfg change has

AIO's for dev/test purposes.

This patch moves the Ansible logging changes to the
gate-check-script only as that's the only time that it's

commit_message:
Move ansible logging to gate-check script only

Enacting the log link creation and the ansible.cfg change has
resulted in polluted patch reviews by developers making use of
AIO's for dev/test purposes.

This patch moves the Ansible logging changes to the
gate-check-script only as that's the only time that it's
actually required.

Change-Id: I4a1accad94ae153bf363b53fda0905e814c15173
Closes-Bug: #1479824

commit_message:
Add swift service region to group vars

The swift service region is currently only set in the swift playbook
defaults file. It needs to be exposed in group vars and controlled by
the global `service_region` variable.

Closes-Bug: #1481700
Change-Id: I458be04582c590d58d1e7130878a9dc1f914c02a

commit_message:
Moves Dynamic Policy specs to Liberty dir

As per Keystone meeting today, we targeted the
Dynamic Policy specs to Liberty [1].

This change moves such specs to /liberty dir. In
addition, it renames the files to match
'Centralized Policies' instead of 'Dynamic
Policies', in order to better match the naming
defined during the review process and then the
title in the specs.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/keystone/2015/keystone.2015-08-11-18.00.log.html

Change-Id: Ic6153e353cb610279e8849c6f99d910de7dfe8ed

commit_message:
Use oslo.log library instead of system logging module

The constants of log levels were added in the 1.8 version of
the oslo.log library. So we can replace all usage of system
logging module with log module from oslo.log.

Change-Id: I2992df0bec6337aefa8a75d4853b132bd134fa42
Closes-Bug: 1481370

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-09 09:44:33.000000000', 'files': ['examples/crypto-md5.py', 'bandit/config/bandit.yaml', 'tests/test_functional.py'], 'message': "Add other known weak MD hash modules

hashlib is not the only module to provide MD5 hashes. PyCrypto and
pyca/cryptography also have functions to do MD5 hashes.  This patch
adds those to the md5 blacklist_calls list. This patch also adds
PyCrypto's MD2 and MD4.

Change-Id: Icd55365f1f7a4cbb34dcb55abc0d77ab8a75f575
"}]
commit_message:
Add other known weak MD hash modules

hashlib is not the only module to provide MD5 hashes. PyCrypto and
pyca/cryptography also have functions to do MD5 hashes.  This patch
adds those to the md5 blacklist_calls list. This patch also adds
PyCrypto's MD2 and MD4.

Change-Id: Icd55365f1f7a4cbb34dcb55abc0d77ab8a75f575

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-07 10:13:13.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_swift/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_tempest/templates/tempest.conf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/os_tempest/defaults/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_swift/templates/proxy-server.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Allow Swift middleware to be set via a variable

This patch allows the swift-proxy pipeline to be adjusted via a variable
"swift_middleware_list", which can be amended to add additional
middleware as required.

The default remains the same - which is to include the default pipeline
when using keystone.

Additionally the logic around whether "authtoken" or "tempauth" are
enabled was changed to check if these are set in "swift_middleware_list"
without requiring a separate variable. Variable "swift_authtoken_active"
was removed as it is no longer required.

Tempest object storage settings were adjusted to work with the default
list of enabled discoverable_apis for object storage. Container syncing
was also turned into a variable based on the object storage default.

Closes-Bug: #1453276
Co-Authored-By: Julian Montez <julian.montez@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Darren Birkett <darren.birkett@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I70565296242d10327a58b02149f73eb5f31a877d
(cherry picked from commit 2ed2bde1b0e728831c17b32b8805a3435f1ee38f)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow Swift middleware to be set via a variable

This patch allows the swift-proxy pipeline to be adjusted via a variable
"swift_middleware_list", which can be amended to add additional
middleware as required.

The default remains the same - which is to include the default pipeline
when using keystone.

Additionally the logic around whether "authtoken" or "tempauth" are
enabled was changed to check if these are set in "swift_middleware_list"
without requiring a separate variable. Variable "swift_authtoken_active"
was removed as it is no longer required.

Tempest object storage settings were adjusted to work with the default
list of enabled discoverable_apis for object storage. Container syncing
was also turned into a variable based on the object storage default.

Closes-Bug: #1453276
Co-Authored-By: Julian Montez <julian.montez@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Darren Birkett <darren.birkett@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I70565296242d10327a58b02149f73eb5f31a877d
(cherry picked from commit 2ed2bde1b0e728831c17b32b8805a3435f1ee38f)

subject: Claim no messages correctly
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1112, 'name': 'Everett Toews', 'email': 'everett.toews@rackspace.com', 'username': 'everett-toews'}, {'_account_id': 8257, 'name': 'Brian Curtin', 'email': 'brian@python.org', 'username': 'briancurtin'}, {'_account_id': 8736, 'name': 'Terry Howe', 'email': 'terrylhowe@gmail.com', 'username': 'terrylhowe'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-28 12:50:14.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/message/v1/claim.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/message/v1/test_claim.py'], 'message': "Claim no messages correctly

The Message Service will respond with a 204 and no content in
the body when there are no messages to claim. The transport
layer doesn't like that and we have to correct for it here.
Ultimately it's a bug in the v1.0 Message Service API.

Users shouldn't have to deal with an InvalidResponse just
because there are no messages to claim. That's a perfectly
normal state for a queue to be in.

It appears to be fixed in v1.1
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Zaqar/specs/api/v1.1#Changes_from_v1.0

Change-Id: I5e8a181ba8f633a387cb8e237e9bf9d90ade680c
"}]
commit_message:
Claim no messages correctly

The Message Service will respond with a 204 and no content in
the body when there are no messages to claim. The transport
layer doesn't like that and we have to correct for it here.
Ultimately it's a bug in the v1.0 Message Service API.

Users shouldn't have to deal with an InvalidResponse just
because there are no messages to claim. That's a perfectly
normal state for a queue to be in.

It appears to be fixed in v1.1
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Zaqar/specs/api/v1.1#Changes_from_v1.0

Change-Id: I5e8a181ba8f633a387cb8e237e9bf9d90ade680c

commit_message:
Centralized Policies Fetch and Cache

Adds to Keystone Middleware the capability to
fetch the Centralized Policy for the current
endpoint and overlay the existing local policy
file with it, using the oslo.policy library.

Co-Authored-By: Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz <samuel@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Partially-Implements: bp dynamic-policies-delivery

Change-Id: I71f63eee8f88402bcefe276cf12546f722bae555

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-07-30 13:47:43.000000000', 'files': ['specs/backlog/dynamic-policies-delivering-mechanism.rst'], 'message': 'Centralized Policies Distribution Mechanism

Adds to Keystone server the capability to control
policy cache in remote service endpoints by using
the appropriate HTTP cache control headers.

Co-Authored-By: Adam Young <ayoung@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Morgan Fainberg <morganfainberg@gmail.com>

Partially-Implements: bp dynamic-policies-delivery

commit_message:
Centralized Policies Distribution Mechanism

Adds to Keystone server the capability to control
policy cache in remote service endpoints by using
the appropriate HTTP cache control headers.

Co-Authored-By: Adam Young <ayoung@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Morgan Fainberg <morganfainberg@gmail.com>

Partially-Implements: bp dynamic-policies-delivery

Change-Id: If15d0206c893f7d4db3d7ce1f94eb69b36c7e1d7

commit_message:
Include DiskFilter in the default list

Include DiskFilter in the default list DiskFilter is pretty critical
for proper operation of a deployment without shared storage, and is
likely to be something most new operators will want enabled. The
DiskFilter is now included in the default set in Nova. So adding it
to manual too.

Change-Id: I1ff200931299d390bc8e8d9759394e7e72e24f75
Closes-bug: #1483352

commit_message:
Don't escape request.get_full_path() in Django1.8

In Django1.8, request.get_full_path() method now escapes
unsafe characters.

Disable the urlquote for containers table when running
in Django1.8.

Closes-Bug: #1482958
Partially Implements: blueprint django18

Change-Id: I4b2051942618ec3b9262a26e2027f17ecb589eb8

commit_message:
Expiration policy for expired Executions

A mechanism that remove old executions (expired) according to Admin policy: how old they are, when executing this policy.
By the default this task is disable.

Change-Id: I15433d176d8e4a499a4466fc9324ceef60ddc4b9
Implements: blueprint expiration-policies-for-executions

commit_message:
Refactor some minor issues to improve code readability

Working on another patch, i notice some issues of code coherence,
difficult readability and unnecessary code on some classes.

This change refactors some code issues like unnecessary conditions,
unnecessary "continue" statements, and extracts method of very large
methods like node.NodesController.patch(), which is a little bit
complex to understand. This change also add the __eq__ function
on ironic/api/controllers/base.py.

Change-Id: If7f1a1786219fe2b4bbadc8e56e67d3ce0c98b34

commit_message:
Fix warnings on doc builds

In the sphinx config, mock out the nova imports we do for the
compute manager so the docs will build with fewer errors.

Exclude the alembic migration environment from autodoc.

Fix the remaining markup errors, which are now easier to spot
given the other fixes.

Note that this leaves one remaining warning, which is that the
generated API documentation isn't currently included in a
toctree. This is easy to fix but it would be good to discuss
whether/where to include it in the documentation hierarchy.

Closes-Bug: 1277282
Change-Id: Iee5fc3eeb95a09198d5234d0ea05e150ab26f16b

commit_message:
Add managed objects hierarchy

Castellan will support multiple objects, not just symmetric keys. The bytes of
the managed object are returned as bytestrings.

commit_message:
Fix common serializers with test case

The current sanitizer in JSONResponseSerializer may risk a cirrcular
reference when the object is of type other than datetime.datetime.
In other words, an object may get sanitized recurrsively. This patch
fixes it and adds a test case.

Change-Id: Ie16f1f76a435c59a5501519ac5230ae3b981e8f1

subject: Do not confuse terminal stack statuses
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7225, 'name': 'Serg Melikyan', 'email': 'smelikyan@mirantis.com', 'username': 'smelikyan'}, {'_account_id': 7227, 'name': 'Timur Nurlygayanov', 'email': 'tnurlygayanov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'tnurlygayanov'}, {'_account_id': 7549, 'name': 'Ekaterina Chernova', 'email': 'katyafervent@yandex.ru', 'username': 'efedorova'}, {'_account_id': 7821, 'name': 'Murano CI', 'username': 'murano-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9408, 'name': 'Michal Gershenzon', 'email': 'michal.gershenzon@gmail.com', 'username': 'Mgershen'}, {'_account_id': 13962, 'name': 'Victor Ryzhenkin', 'email': 'vryzhenkin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vryzhenkin'}, {'_account_id': 15168, 'name': 'Kirill Zaitsev', 'email': 'k.zaitsev@me.com', 'username': 'kzaitsev'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-10 16:04:14.000000000', 'files': ['murano/engine/system/heat_stack.py'], 'message': "Do not confuse terminal stack statuses

When stack update issued HeatStack waits for terminal
status to arrive. However if operation hasn't started yet
status of previous operation may be returned which can
be CREATE_COMPLETE which leaded to exception to be
raised or UPDATE_COMPLETE of previous update which
caused stack.push() to exit early.

 Now update operation will wait until stack status change
 from the state it was before update was issued. This is tracked
 by comparing previous and current tuple(creation time, update time)

Change-Id: I3829f6945b590b942506d4b512e902939053d107
Closes-Bug: #1482989
"}]
commit_message:
Do not confuse terminal stack statuses

When stack update issued HeatStack waits for terminal
status to arrive. However if operation hasn't started yet
status of previous operation may be returned which can
be CREATE_COMPLETE which leaded to exception to be
raised or UPDATE_COMPLETE of previous update which
caused stack.push() to exit early.

 Now update operation will wait until stack status change
 from the state it was before update was issued. This is tracked
 by comparing previous and current tuple(creation time, update time)

Change-Id: I3829f6945b590b942506d4b512e902939053d107
Closes-Bug: #1482989

commit_message:
Extend User from AbstractBaseUser and AnonymousUser

Django-1.8 added _meta classes for User models,
which aren't supported by AnonymousUsers, the
AbstractBaseUser provides default implementation
for _meta classes.

SimpleTest has been deprecated since Django-1.6 and
was now removed.

Unfortunately, this change drops Django-1.6 (and earlier) compatibility.

Co-Authored-By: Lin Hua Cheng <os.lcheng@gmail.com>

Partially Implements: blueprint django18
Change-Id: Ie243fd2304421694023f579f49f8fa201e761ba3

Add wait for delete method

Add wait for delete method to resource and add two proxy
methods to wait for delete for servers and stacks.

Change-Id: Iaff65457e94ffd5f64f5951f0c2ba211f4f06bdd

Fix HTTP headers case for API unit tests

Some of HTTP headers have different case using python3.
Consider it in our unit tests to improve py 2/3 compatibility.

Partially-Implements: bp py3-compatibility

Driver-specific requirements are not hard requirements, since the
choice of drivers is up to the operator. The oslo.vmware module is
herein moved out of requirements.txt and instead listed as an optional
dependency using the extras functionality in setup.cfg.

A check is added to the vmdk driver to gracefully handle import errors
if the vmdk driver is used and oslo.vmware is not found.

Change-Id: I9b00edc38f0700304a1a164f0679a734f8701ebe
Closes-Bug: #1475739
'}]
commit_message:
mark oslo.vmware as optional dependency

Driver-specific requirements are not hard requirements, since the
choice of drivers is up to the operator. The oslo.vmware module is
herein moved out of requirements.txt and instead listed as an optional
dependency using the extras functionality in setup.cfg.

A check is added to the vmdk driver to gracefully handle import errors
if the vmdk driver is used and oslo.vmware is not found.

Change-Id: I9b00edc38f0700304a1a164f0679a734f8701ebe
Closes-Bug: #1475739

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-07-23 13:44:53.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_imagebackend.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/imagebackend.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: fix disk I/O QOS support with RBD

The disk I/O QOS settings were set in the libvirt_info
method of the Image class. While this is fine for most
subclasses, the Rbd subclass overrides this method and
so was loosing the QOS settings. Move the setting of
QOS parameters into a separate method so it can be
called in all places that need it. For added fun the
commit 86e6f34 which added QOS settings originally never
added any unit tests to cover its operation.

Co-authored: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
Fixes bug #1405367
Change-Id: Ibb3a4dff8996c29ef921be7c56648a442bbb89a2
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: fix disk I/O QOS support with RBD

The disk I/O QOS settings were set in the libvirt_info
method of the Image class. While this is fine for most
subclasses, the Rbd subclass overrides this method and
so was loosing the QOS settings. Move the setting of
QOS parameters into a separate method so it can be
called in all places that need it. For added fun the
commit 86e6f34 which added QOS settings originally never
added any unit tests to cover its operation.

Co-authored: Daniel P. Berrange <berrange@redhat.com>
Fixes bug #1405367
Change-Id: Ibb3a4dff8996c29ef921be7c56648a442bbb89a2

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6537, 'name': 'gordon chung', 'email': 'gord@live.ca', 'username': 'chungg'}, {'_account_id': 8302, 'name': 'Ryan Hsu', 'email': 'hryan@vmware.com', 'username': 'rhsu'}, {'_account_id': 10987, 'name': 'Igor Degtiarov', 'username': 'tovstun', 'inactive': True}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-07 21:55:22.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Fix requirements.txt to be compatible with dh_python2

The current requirements.txt has two dependencies (pbr and
requests) that have version exclusion clauses following their
names. This is causing the dh_python2 script, which is used in
Ubuntu packaging python-ceilometerclient for 2015.1.1, to fail.
The reason is due to the way that dh_python2 performs the parsing
for the requirements. The workaround fix is to move the exclusion
clauses to the end of the line.

Change-Id: I7078da3d1f198f4d95770c29de362d56260f6c8d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix requirements.txt to be compatible with dh_python2

The current requirements.txt has two dependencies (pbr and
requests) that have version exclusion clauses following their
names. This is causing the dh_python2 script, which is used in
Ubuntu packaging python-ceilometerclient for 2015.1.1, to fail.
The reason is due to the way that dh_python2 performs the parsing
for the requirements. The workaround fix is to move the exclusion
clauses to the end of the line.

Change-Id: I7078da3d1f198f4d95770c29de362d56260f6c8d

commit_message:
Disable `Edit Environment` when it is deleting

Action `Edit Environment` is forbidden while environment is deleting,
so it's should be hidden.

This is a cherry-pick of 0b8001e21c3ca6d16d41eeee4bcf080e34cda1e7

Change-Id: If39e29011bbf3d8affbf6fcb644b1464afac8922
Related-bug: #1447616

subject: Allow an initial "burst" of config polls on (re)start
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 12321, 'name': 'Ryan Brown', 'email': 'rybrown@redhat.com', 'username': 'ryansb'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-26 17:16:18.000000000', 'files': ['os_collect_config/collect.py'], 'message': 'Allow an initial "burst" of config polls on (re)start

When polling heat for a long series of sequential deployments, it's
possible that the immediate re-exec on completion won't allow time
after signalling heat for the next deployment(s) to be available.

So this adds the option to ramp up the polling delay after a re-exec
such that we do a couple of quick polls on restart, in an attempt to
avoid always waiting the full 30s default poll delay when there is
more data to process.  The sleep path for "no change" isn't modified,
since the additional polling overhead is probably only justified when
a long series of deployments happens.

Change-Id: I8a80b3f7e734400f79c35fdd7314018167d2f47d
'}]
commit_message:
Allow an initial "burst" of config polls on (re)start

When polling heat for a long series of sequential deployments, it's
possible that the immediate re-exec on completion won't allow time
after signalling heat for the next deployment(s) to be available.

So this adds the option to ramp up the polling delay after a re-exec
such that we do a couple of quick polls on restart, in an attempt to
avoid always waiting the full 30s default poll delay when there is
more data to process.  The sleep path for "no change" isn't modified,
since the additional polling overhead is probably only justified when
a long series of deployments happens.

Change-Id: I8a80b3f7e734400f79c35fdd7314018167d2f47d

commit_message:
Add sphinx extension to build sample config

This commit adds a sphinx extension which can be loaded in a sphinx
config.py to generate a sample config file using oslo-config-generator
during each sphinx build. This can then be incorporated into
documentation as necessary.

Co-Authored-By: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
Change-Id: I2561155749fc8c6a8e31df1614ca6cdb50b4c001

commit_message:
Require Nova Network if vCenter is used

Fuel cannot deploy clusters, if they use vCenter and
Neutron as a network provider. This patch restricts
network provider selection to Nova Network for the
mentioned cases.

Change-Id: I4b4f861058f6b93ec519fa1d655edecb5cee90aa
Closes-bug: #1470488

If we wilcard resolve names like if a user passes in "foo" and there's
a domain or entity called "foo.io" it will match and return foo.io.

'}]
commit_message:
Don't wildcard resolve names

If we wilcard resolve names like if a user passes in "foo" and there's
a domain or entity called "foo.io" it will match and return foo.io.

Removing the *name* makes it match the wanted behaviour.

Change-Id: I0c0167384952d5d302909b06a3f5597add8f9ff9

commit_message:
check if dnsmasq runs after switching to different bootstrap image

Sometimes dnsmasq stops after running `cobbler sync' command, which
breaks PXE boot. Restart dnsmasq after reconfiguring cobbler to work
around the problem.

Closes-Bug: #1482242
Change-Id: I5d6949bea15d86decd727ce9d4c4b2408fed7e05

When running the tests, rspec will download the modules speficied in
.fixtures.yml and put them in spec/fixtures/modules.

Some of those modules still point to stackforge/ namespace when they
should be pointing to openstack/ namespace.

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-07-08 06:20:42.000000000', 'files': ['etc/ceilometer/event_definitions.yaml', 'ceilometer/api/controllers/v2/events.py', 'ceilometer/api/rbac.py'], 'message': 'Add user/project information to audit event traits

The current Event Trait definition does not define user or
project information related to an event for certain events
like the audit events. Due to this ownership information
related to an audit event can never be established. This
interferes with applying Role Based Access Control related
rules on an audit Event (basically means that rules cannot
be defined in the policy.json).Associating user/project
information with an Event might not be too significant a
requirement when it comes to common events, but this becomes
a critical need when it comes to audit-related events (
with event_types *.http.*)

Closes-Bug: 1461767

Change-Id: Ie6bfe67732858dba91050bbb4604bf1c7bcc45f2
'}]
commit_message:
Add user/project information to audit event traits

The current Event Trait definition does not define user or
project information related to an event for certain events
like the audit events. Due to this ownership information
related to an audit event can never be established. This
interferes with applying Role Based Access Control related
rules on an audit Event (basically means that rules cannot
be defined in the policy.json).Associating user/project
information with an Event might not be too significant a
requirement when it comes to common events, but this becomes
a critical need when it comes to audit-related events (
with event_types *.http.*)

Closes-Bug: 1461767

Change-Id: Ie6bfe67732858dba91050bbb4604bf1c7bcc45f2

commit_message:
Catch any exception from base64.b64decode during validation

Contrary to documentation, base64.b64decode can raise an exception
other than TypeError, for example if non-ascii is encountered in payload.
This patch catches all exceptions from base64.b64decode and updates
unit and functional tests to verify.

Change-Id: I899cdf1fe8497c4098c138c68ced4c6564ae0007
Closes-bug: #1481090

subject: Fix ability to recover from an existing appliance VM
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2592, 'name': 'Mark McClain', 'email': 'mark@mcclain.xyz', 'username': 'markmcclain'}, {'_account_id': 8005, 'name': 'Ryan Petrello', 'email': 'ryan@ryanpetrello.com', 'username': 'ryanpetrello'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-06 19:06:33.000000000', 'files': ['akanda/rug/api/nova.py', 'akanda/rug/test/unit/api/test_nova_wrapper.py', 'akanda/rug/vm_manager.py', 'akanda/rug/test/unit/test_vmmanager.py'], 'message': 'Fix ability to recover from an existing appliance VM

This fixes two issues discovered when trying to reboot a devstack
host, which is similar to a full datacenter reboot.

First, the RUG currently tries to delete any existing non-alive VMs
it finds for a router.  Its failing to do that ATM, attempting to
use an ID from the wrong object.

With that fixed, the VM manager and state machine are still incapable of
removing and starting with a fresh appliance VM.  Currently, the pass
through the state machine that detects and deletes the existing VM counts
as a negative boot attempt and the execution does not clear its cached
instance_info after its deleted the instance.  This causes another pass
through the state with a stale instance_info that again counts against
the boot count.  That causes the router to get set to ERROR and future
POLL events to get dropped, leading to no replacement router to booting.

Change-Id: I7d1a0a58886088cf279a68b5aaf4cff2a678e16a
Closes-bug: #1468045
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ability to recover from an existing appliance VM

This fixes two issues discovered when trying to reboot a devstack
host, which is similar to a full datacenter reboot.

First, the RUG currently tries to delete any existing non-alive VMs
it finds for a router.  Its failing to do that ATM, attempting to
use an ID from the wrong object.

With that fixed, the VM manager and state machine are still incapable of
removing and starting with a fresh appliance VM.  Currently, the pass
through the state machine that detects and deletes the existing VM counts
as a negative boot attempt and the execution does not clear its cached
instance_info after its deleted the instance.  This causes another pass
through the state with a stale instance_info that again counts against
the boot count.  That causes the router to get set to ERROR and future
POLL events to get dropped, leading to no replacement router to booting.

Change-Id: I7d1a0a58886088cf279a68b5aaf4cff2a678e16a
Closes-bug: #1468045

devstack: Create a custom nova flavor for the appliance

image.  This creates a flavor with bigger disk support but less memory.
