subject: Various devstack cleanups
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1420, 'name': 'Adam Gandelman', 'email': 'adamg@ubuntu.com', 'username': 'gandelman-a'}, {'_account_id': 2592, 'name': 'Mark McClain', 'email': 'mark@mcclain.xyz', 'username': 'markmcclain'}, {'_account_id': 8005, 'name': 'Ryan Petrello', 'email': 'ryan@ryanpetrello.com', 'username': 'ryanpetrello'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-23 00:30:22.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh', 'devstack/settings'], 'message': 'Various devstack cleanups

* Do not create the public network if its been created already

* Explicitly disable neutron services that do not need to run (they are
enabled by default in the gate)

* Remove subnets twice: There is some issue with the masking of port subne IDs
we do that is causing issue when removing subnets in devstack. It works the second
time?

* Stop using a hard-coded network name

* Stop q-svc using the correct function depending on screen config: stop_process
pkills the thing and leaves a q-svc.failure flag file when using screen, that
fails the devstack run.

* set the correct API port in horizon config

Change-Id: I5d088e2cb485a6ae74d45d738a0083cba4b66ff8
(cherry picked from commit 8b43b801e31b67387ad89ecb232c17dd9c559ec0)
'}]
commit_message:
Various devstack cleanups

* Do not create the public network if its been created already

* Explicitly disable neutron services that do not need to run (they are
enabled by default in the gate)

* Remove subnets twice: There is some issue with the masking of port subne IDs
we do that is causing issue when removing subnets in devstack. It works the second
time?

* Stop using a hard-coded network name

* Stop q-svc using the correct function depending on screen config: stop_process
pkills the thing and leaves a q-svc.failure flag file when using screen, that
fails the devstack run.

* set the correct API port in horizon config

Change-Id: I5d088e2cb485a6ae74d45d738a0083cba4b66ff8
(cherry picked from commit 8b43b801e31b67387ad89ecb232c17dd9c559ec0)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-10 23:00:58.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/environments/topology.py'], 'message': 'Do not render topology for env with empty services

Topology rendering code expects services to be an iterable.
During environment deletion however services can be None.
This commit makes topology code aware of this fact and prevents any
further job if environment.services is None.

Closes-Bug: #1483420

Change-Id: I2edbd2342c163c6c180c6238fa933c42f94e4d87
'}]
commit_message:
Do not render topology for env with empty services

Topology rendering code expects services to be an iterable.
During environment deletion however services can be None.
This commit makes topology code aware of this fact and prevents any
further job if environment.services is None.

Closes-Bug: #1483420

commit_message:
Catalog: show package_count for categories.

Filtering by a category, that does not contain any packages would result
in an empty set of packages. We can prevent user from doing so, by
disaplying number of packages in a category.
This commit changes packages.categories to categories.list, that
includes package_count information and outputs the information in the
dropdown menu.
This commit also sorts categories so that categories with packages
are listed before categories without packages
(both groups alphabetically ordered) for better ux.

Change-Id: Ieaa0d64cd4bc703f4918fa41cb280288f76c2aa2
Related-Bug: #1454865

commit_message:
Add environment-session-create command

This commit adds a command, that allows to explicitly create a new
configuration session for a murano environment.
Session id is required, for example, by deploy, edit, get commands/API calls.

While murano-dashboard is able to hide the session id in a
django-session, there is no such place to store session id, when using
CLI, therfore this command makes session creation explicit.

Targets blueprint: env-configuration-from-cli

Change-Id: I10b4f912e6dc28c62ac0c31ca05956dc63f4950d

commit_message:
Use openstack/ namespace for fixtures modules

When running the tests, rspec will download the modules speficied in
.fixtures.yml and put them in spec/fixtures/modules.

Some of those modules still point to stackforge/ namespace when they
should be pointing to openstack/ namespace.

Change-Id: I1070c4c2200f22d60947c15b9414881c7eddae06

commit_message:
Projects in Dropdown Header as Hierarchical Names

This patch allows project choices to be shown as
hierarchical names in the Project Selector of the
dropdown header.

If a project has parents, its name is added by
its parents names, separated by slashes. For
example:

    GrandParent
    GrandParent / Parent
    GrandParent / Parent / Child

This patch requires the Kilo version of both
Keystone and Keystone Client, whose support the
Hierarchical Projects concept as a stable API.

Co-Authored-By: Erickson Filipe Guedes dos Santos <erickson@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Thiago Paiva Brito <thiagop@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Partially Implements: blueprint hierarchical-project

Change-Id: I3930ffe9cd54d7e76185f1d3b64b254537739b62

commit_message:
User Primary Project Choices as Hierarchical Names

This patch allows primary project choices to be
shown as hierarchical names in the Create User
modal.

If a primary project has parents, its name is
added by its parents names, separated by slashes.
For example:

    GrandParent
    GrandParent / Parent
    GrandParent / Parent / Child

This patch requires the Kilo version of both
Keystone and Keystone Client, whose support the
Hierarchical Projects concept as a stable API.

Co-Authored-By: Erickson Filipe Guedes dos Santos <erickson@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Partially Implements: blueprint hierarchical-projects

Change-Id: Ib39a5ed42ebf4b2d135b0b1ff5fafe3e2da434d0

subject: Remove quotes from subshell call in deployGuacamole.sh
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 10374, 'name': 'Alexander Bochkarev', 'email': 'abochkarev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'abochkarev'}, {'_account_id': 15168, 'name': 'Kirill Zaitsev', 'email': 'k.zaitsev@me.com', 'username': 'kzaitsev'}, {'_account_id': 17789, 'name': 'Zhao Lei', 'email': 'zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com', 'username': 'zhaolei'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-08 07:09:49.000000000', 'files': ['Guacamole/package/Resources/scripts/deployGuacamole.sh'], 'message': 'Remove quotes from subshell call in deployGuacamole.sh

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code in deployGuacamole.sh, only to use a
better code style.

Change-Id: I81f9790654fefc46515fe2eaa1a07e16dd408676
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove quotes from subshell call in deployGuacamole.sh

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code in deployGuacamole.sh, only to use a
better code style.

Change-Id: I81f9790654fefc46515fe2eaa1a07e16dd408676
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
WIP Angularize Identity Projects Panel

This patch applies angularized tables to the
identity projects panel. To test it, go to url /identity/angularprojects.

Note: for domain info to show properly in the create/edit modal form,
'OPENSTACK_API_VERSIONS' should be set in REST_API_REQUIRED_SETTINGS in
local_settings.py.

Partially Implements: blueprint angularize-identity-tables

Co-Authored-By: Erickson Filipe Guedes dos Santos <erickson@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Paulo Ewerton Gomes Fragoso <pauloewerton@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Change-Id: Ia0a596516d249175e1983f2e09078a4f3ffeb04a

subject: Raise minimum required neutronclient to >=2.4.0
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 105, 'name': 'Kyle Mestery', 'email': 'mestery@mestery.com', 'username': 'mestery'}, {'_account_id': 1420, 'name': 'Adam Gandelman', 'email': 'adamg@ubuntu.com', 'username': 'gandelman-a'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4190, 'name': 'lifeless', 'email': 'robertc@robertcollins.net', 'username': 'lifeless'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-10 14:03:51.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Raise minimum required neutronclient to >=2.4.0

python-neutronclient 2.3.12 caps requirements from juno
global-requirements per commit 3f03a3bdb87782930eaf236f726f9bed7229e441
which is a problem since it's currently allowed into kilo and conflicts
with the minimum required versions of other libraries in kilo.

This makes grenade in kilo fail since neutronclient is installed as
2.3.12 on the old (juno) side but not upgraded on the new (kilo) side,
and then we hit version conflicts eventually with oslo.serialization.

The least of all evils at this point is to raise the minimum required
version of neutronclient to 2.4.0 in kilo since 2.3.* is all juno at
this point.

In retrospect we would have done a better job of bumping the minor
version in neutronclient releases when there are dependency changes so
we wouldn't have wedged ourselves like this, but there isn't much that
can be done about it now.  Hopefully most deployments that shippped kilo
were already using at least 2.4.0 and this isn't a problem for them.

Closes-Bug: #1482758

Change-Id: Ifda08076deb0026de4e1be83a98c08ac73f560f6
"}]
commit_message:
Raise minimum required neutronclient to >=2.4.0

python-neutronclient 2.3.12 caps requirements from juno
global-requirements per commit 3f03a3bdb87782930eaf236f726f9bed7229e441
which is a problem since it's currently allowed into kilo and conflicts
with the minimum required versions of other libraries in kilo.

This makes grenade in kilo fail since neutronclient is installed as
2.3.12 on the old (juno) side but not upgraded on the new (kilo) side,
and then we hit version conflicts eventually with oslo.serialization.

The least of all evils at this point is to raise the minimum required
version of neutronclient to 2.4.0 in kilo since 2.3.* is all juno at
this point.

In retrospect we would have done a better job of bumping the minor
version in neutronclient releases when there are dependency changes so
we wouldn't have wedged ourselves like this, but there isn't much that
can be done about it now.  Hopefully most deployments that shippped kilo
were already using at least 2.4.0 and this isn't a problem for them.

Closes-Bug: #1482758

Change-Id: Ifda08076deb0026de4e1be83a98c08ac73f560f6

api: fix alarm deletion and update

The API allow the actions to be null.

This allow the alarm to be deleted and updated in this case.

Backported from:

https://github.com/openstack/aodh/commit/b40b4513e61cd76a11e031d5b77bffbda1d012f6

Closes bug: #1479274

commit_message:
change deprecated assertEquals to assertEqual

fix against H234: assertEquals() logs a DeprecationWarning
in Python3.x. use assertEqual() instead.

Closes-bug: #1480776

Change-Id: Iffda6bb5f2616d4af4567eeea37bb26531e34371
Signed-off-by: Hiroshi Miura <miurahr@nttdata.co.jp>

When in the case of a non-activated virtualenv, freezer-scheduler was no able
to find the freezerc binary because it search it with distutils find_executable
which uses os.environ['path'] and not sys.path.

Change-Id: Ia0b70e0abbe13a8421f5fe2725831f06318cbe45
"}]
commit_message:
Allow freezer-scheduler to find freezerc binary in a non-activated virtualenv

When in the case of a non-activated virtualenv, freezer-scheduler was no able
to find the freezerc binary because it search it with distutils find_executable
which uses os.environ['path'] and not sys.path.

If the binary is not found, we now fall back to sys.path

Change-Id: Ia0b70e0abbe13a8421f5fe2725831f06318cbe45

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-08-10 22:43:52.000000000', 'files': ['rally/task/context.py', 'tests/unit/plugins/common/runners/test_serial.py', 'tests/unit/plugins/common/runners/test_rps.py', 'tests/unit/fakes.py', 'rally/plugins/openstack/context/sahara/sahara_cluster.py', 'rally/plugins/openstack/context/sahara/sahara_image.py', 'rally/plugins/openstack/context/glance/images.py', 'tests/unit/plugins/openstack/context/glance/test_images.py', 'rally/plugins/openstack/context/keystone/users.py', 'tests/unit/plugins/common/runners/test_constant.py', 'tests/unit/plugins/openstack/context/keystone/test_users.py', 'rally/plugins/openstack/context/sahara/sahara_edp.py', 'tests/unit/task/test_runner.py', 'rally/plugins/openstack/context/keystone/existing_users.py', 'rally/plugins/openstack/context/keystone/roles.py', 'tests/unit/task/test_context.py', 'rally/task/runner.py'], 'message': "Make context plugins decide how to map their data for scenario

Previously to have only one user and its context during the run
of scenario we had hack inside base runner to map full context
for scenario.

This patch makes context classes resposible for that. E.g. you
can implement method that will somehow map resources of context
for each run of scenario.

Fix context.__init__() methods they shouldn't change context
object.

There are 3 great benifits of this change:

- You don't need hacks to map resources created by context
  for scenarios, which will be crucial for other projects

- You don't need hacks to make mapping strategies configurable
  e.g. pick users randomly or 1 by 1 and so on

- Rally framework depends less on OpenStack stuff

Change-Id: Ie5915cd35b27cb1988465ba33179721bf61224c7
"}]
commit_message:
Make context plugins decide how to map their data for scenario

Previously to have only one user and its context during the run
of scenario we had hack inside base runner to map full context
for scenario.

This patch makes context classes resposible for that. E.g. you
can implement method that will somehow map resources of context
for each run of scenario.

Fix context.__init__() methods they shouldn't change context
object.

There are 3 great benifits of this change:

- You don't need hacks to map resources created by context
  for scenarios, which will be crucial for other projects

- You don't need hacks to make mapping strategies configurable
  e.g. pick users randomly or 1 by 1 and so on

- Rally framework depends less on OpenStack stuff

Change-Id: Ie5915cd35b27cb1988465ba33179721bf61224c7

commit_message:
Bump version to 7.0. Update code from upstream repo

1. Bump version to 7.0

2. Use perestroika v5 repo schema

3. Fixing pool permissions after rsync
This change corrects the permissions of the pool folder so that it can
be consumed as a repository mirror via nginx.

4. Add packages (deb, rpm) specs

Related-bug: #1478118
Related-bug: #1476561
Change-Id: Iada03ddab5b7d551f13692cb1c87a634c2f10947

commit_message:
Update public key for devops repo

Since key for devops repo [1] was changed, we need to update it:
 apt-key adv --keyserver hkp://keyserver.ubuntu.com:80 --recv-keys 1D2B45A2

subject: Use pip to install the package
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 9312, 'name': 'Alexandre Levine', 'email': 'alexandrelevine@gmail.com', 'username': 'alevine'}, {'_account_id': 10224, 'name': 'Feodor Tersin', 'email': 'ftersin@hotmail.com', 'username': 'ftersin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-11 13:26:33.000000000', 'files': ['install.sh'], 'message': 'Use pip to install the package

The installation by pip do not deeply scan requirements. For example it
allows
SQLAlchemy==1.0.5
sqlalchemy-migrate==0.9.6
for requirements
SQLAlchemy>=0.9.7,<1.1.0
sqlalchemy-migrate>=0.9.6
despite sqlalchemy-migreate v0.9.6 requires SQLAlchemy<=0.9.99.

The installation by direct call of setup.py downgrades installed
packages of DefStack installation, which may lead to problems.

Since DevStack uses pip to install packages, ec2api should install
packages by the same manner.

Change-Id: I5b02b4c318ba96e8e6855d921bef96d90f5f1c45
'}]
commit_message:
Use pip to install the package

The installation by pip do not deeply scan requirements. For example it
allows
SQLAlchemy==1.0.5
sqlalchemy-migrate==0.9.6
for requirements
SQLAlchemy>=0.9.7,<1.1.0
sqlalchemy-migrate>=0.9.6
despite sqlalchemy-migreate v0.9.6 requires SQLAlchemy<=0.9.99.

The installation by direct call of setup.py downgrades installed
packages of DefStack installation, which may lead to problems.

Since DevStack uses pip to install packages, ec2api should install
packages by the same manner.

Change-Id: I5b02b4c318ba96e8e6855d921bef96d90f5f1c45

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-06-09 14:18:27.000000000', 'files': ['guidelines/http.rst'], 'message': "add subsection around caching behavior and http

One of the reasons things like the 501 debate go around in circles is
because the caching implications aren't being thought about. Caching
and Proxies are an extremely fundamental concept in HTTP, but often
skipped over by folks new to it. It's important to call it out
especially as the CORS support and javascript in browser native
clients are going to have dramatically different behavior here than
the python requests library that most people are familiar with.

Change-Id: Ibc6eb07cb53e4dc5a8cee875d0eb356333465b1b
"}]
commit_message:
add subsection around caching behavior and http

One of the reasons things like the 501 debate go around in circles is
because the caching implications aren't being thought about. Caching
and Proxies are an extremely fundamental concept in HTTP, but often
skipped over by folks new to it. It's important to call it out
especially as the CORS support and javascript in browser native
clients are going to have dramatically different behavior here than
the python requests library that most people are familiar with.

Change-Id: Ibc6eb07cb53e4dc5a8cee875d0eb356333465b1b

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-23 12:01:58.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/hyperv/vmutils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_vmutils.py'], 'message': 'Hyper-V: Fixes method retrieving free SCSI controller slot on V1

The method retrieving a free SCSI controller slot gets all the
related disk resources, checking their address using the
AddressOnParent attribute.

The issue is that this WMI object attribute is not available on the
V1 virtualization namespace, for which reason this method will raise
an AttributeError in case there disks connected to the SCSI
controller.

This patch fixes the issue by properly retrieving the disk address.

Closes-Bug: #1467916

Change-Id: I7f88e37ac6d13cd8a15b17939ec8dbdca2c988e1
'}]
commit_message:
Hyper-V: Fixes method retrieving free SCSI controller slot on V1

The method retrieving a free SCSI controller slot gets all the
related disk resources, checking their address using the
AddressOnParent attribute.

The issue is that this WMI object attribute is not available on the
V1 virtualization namespace, for which reason this method will raise
an AttributeError in case there disks connected to the SCSI
controller.

This patch fixes the issue by properly retrieving the disk address.

Closes-Bug: #1467916

Change-Id: I7f88e37ac6d13cd8a15b17939ec8dbdca2c988e1

  * methods = external, password, token, oauth1

Closes-bug: #1482460

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-10 16:10:11.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'nova/utils.py'], 'message': 'Suppress not image properties for image metadata from volume

Currently image metadata restored from a bootable volume has some
properties which are not properties of an original image. But Nova
stores these properties into system metadata of an instance booted from
the volume and into properties of snapshot image of the instance. This
leads to consuming of waste DB space, increases traffic with DB, and
confuses end users by unexpected image properties of instnace snapshot.

The reason is that Cinder stores image attributes (id, name, checksum,
etc) as volume image metadata together with true image metadata. Then
Nova loads this metadata and uses it as properties of image metadata as
is, with no modification.

This patch removes this artifical properties from loaded volume image
metadata.

Related-Bug: #1439819
Change-Id: Ic1155449aa47170ffd4e6e87e50de0a4cb5732da
'}]
commit_message:
Suppress not image properties for image metadata from volume

Currently image metadata restored from a bootable volume has some
properties which are not properties of an original image. But Nova
stores these properties into system metadata of an instance booted from
the volume and into properties of snapshot image of the instance. This
leads to consuming of waste DB space, increases traffic with DB, and
confuses end users by unexpected image properties of instnace snapshot.

The reason is that Cinder stores image attributes (id, name, checksum,
etc) as volume image metadata together with true image metadata. Then
Nova loads this metadata and uses it as properties of image metadata as
is, with no modification.

This patch removes this artifical properties from loaded volume image
metadata.

Related-Bug: #1439819
Change-Id: Ic1155449aa47170ffd4e6e87e50de0a4cb5732da

Warnings are not shown any more in Welcome block on Dashboard

   - also little reshuffle: error warnings moved out recommendations block
   - fixed warning about unique "key" prop
   - removed unused states

Closes-Bug: #1482715

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-05 15:04:06.000000000', 'files': ['guidelines/pagination_filter_sort.rst'], 'message': 'No project uses f_ prefix in filter params

We should not introduce an f_ prefix recommendation for filtering
query parameters, since not a single project in OpenStack uses them.
This introduces pointless jitter to the API WG guidelines and the actual
APIs of our endpoints.

Change-Id: I4bbbd3c81fa93d76195a895557e91aeef012657b
'}]
commit_message:
No project uses f_ prefix in filter params

We should not introduce an f_ prefix recommendation for filtering
query parameters, since not a single project in OpenStack uses them.
This introduces pointless jitter to the API WG guidelines and the actual
APIs of our endpoints.

Change-Id: I4bbbd3c81fa93d76195a895557e91aeef012657b

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-08 14:48:53.000000000', 'files': ['guidelines/http.rst'], 'message': "RFC 5789 doesn't specify certain uses of PUT

RFC 5789 allows omitting PUT fields only in so much as it doesn't
disallow them. Clarify that in the guidelines on PUT vs PATCH.

Change-Id: I84c4833e85a41904a6f84fb5fe682533f5a2c8d3
"}]
commit_message:
RFC 5789 doesn't specify certain uses of PUT

RFC 5789 allows omitting PUT fields only in so much as it doesn't
disallow them. Clarify that in the guidelines on PUT vs PATCH.

Change-Id: I84c4833e85a41904a6f84fb5fe682533f5a2c8d3

commit_message:
Move existing V2 to legacy_v2

The first step in the code cleanup for removing the API V3 references is
to move the existing default V2 code into a directory named 'legacy_v2'.
This moves the files, and updates all references to them.

There are some reference for keeping v2 API api-paste.ini entry and options
works as before.

* Add reference for RateLimit Middleware in 'nova/api/openstack/compute/limits.py'
* Add reference for Versions Middleware in 'nova/api/openstack/compute/versions.py'
* Add reference for osapi_compute_extension option's value in
  'nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/__init__.py'

Partial-Bug: #1462901
Co-Authored-By: Alex Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>
Change-Id: I96727c5de36ee2a9b225523b8e795928dc26711a

commit_message:
Move the v3 files into the main directories

WIP - do not merge.

This step gets rid of all of the 'v3' directories, as they are no longer
needed, and moves the contents into the main API directories. All of the
existing v2 code has been moved into the 'legacy_v2' directories, and
the former v3 code will now be in the standard development location.
Also, as many references to 'v3' in the code as we could find have been
replaced with 'v21'.

Change-Id: I81309b01a1871ceb11ef1dcd9c480be6942ce7e6
Partial-Bug: #1462901

commit_message:
scalar-unit data type support as template input parameters

Rounding scalr-unit.size to next GB if it value is not multiples
of GBs.

Added unittest cases
modified messages and exception string as per i18n standard

Change-Id: Ia3bb82d4d0b9596376fec80a8b8b803352d94975
Closes-Bug: #1474142

This patch is in preparation for the integration
of Ironic and Neutron. A new vnic_type is being
added so that ML2 drivers can filter for all
Ironic ports based upon match for 'baremetal'.
Nova/Ironic will set this vnic_type when issuing

commit_message:
Neutron-Ironic integration patch

This patch is in preparation for the integration
of Ironic and Neutron. A new vnic_type is being
added so that ML2 drivers can filter for all
Ironic ports based upon match for 'baremetal'.
Nova/Ironic will set this vnic_type when issuing
port-create request to neutron.
(e.g. binding:vnic_type = 'baremetal' )

Change-Id: I25dc9472b31db052719db503a10c1fb1a55572ef
Partial-Implements: blueprint neutron-ironic-integration

commit_message:
Implement transactions for create_qos_bw_limit_for_port

Add rollback capability in create_qos_bw_limit_for_port so that
the multiple changes will be rolled back if the transaction fails.

Co-Authored-By: James Reeves <james.reeves5546@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I77c7c8be413b0736c2775552079f2df28dc2e130

commit_message:
Ironic:check the configuration item api_max_retries

we need to to check the value of the configuration item api_max_retries in
the code in order to ensure the " api_max_retries " equal or bigger than 0
,done like that the configuration item network_allocate_retries

Co-Authored-By: Kevin_Zheng <zhengzhenyu@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I034d726398b4bdabd34f96a3b30ae4d48c1d3fb6
Closes-Bug: #1372432

subject: Remove newlines in base64.encodestring
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2284, 'name': 'Eoghan Glynn', 'email': 'eglynn@redhat.com', 'username': 'eglynn'}, {'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 6676, 'name': 'zqfan', 'email': 'aji.zqfan@gmail.com', 'username': 'aji-zqfan'}, {'_account_id': 7409, 'name': 'Eric Pendergrass', 'email': 'epende@gmail.com', 'username': 'epende'}, {'_account_id': 10987, 'name': 'Igor Degtiarov', 'username': 'tovstun', 'inactive': True}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-27 11:46:04.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/api/v2/test_list_meters_scenarios.py', 'ceilometer/api/controllers/v2.py'], 'message': 'Remove newlines in base64.encodestring

MIME specifies a maximum line length of 76 characters, most
implementations of base64 use a newline to delimit encoded lines.
Since we use it as uuid, the delimit is not necessary.

Meanwhile, base64.encodestring will always add an extra newline in
the end of returned string, for short string, end user will notice
this newline delimiter in ReST API but it just disappears in CLI API
because our CLI utils ignore the newline silently.

This patch removes all newline characters in base64.encodestring
returned value.

Change-Id: I20e2a474e29037ec0596084d98a7fec6c4bd6021
ref: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Base64#MIME
Closes-Bug: #1271530
'}]
commit_message:
Remove newlines in base64.encodestring

MIME specifies a maximum line length of 76 characters, most
implementations of base64 use a newline to delimit encoded lines.
Since we use it as uuid, the delimit is not necessary.

Meanwhile, base64.encodestring will always add an extra newline in
the end of returned string, for short string, end user will notice
this newline delimiter in ReST API but it just disappears in CLI API
because our CLI utils ignore the newline silently.

This patch removes all newline characters in base64.encodestring
returned value.

Change-Id: I20e2a474e29037ec0596084d98a7fec6c4bd6021
ref: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Base64#MIME
Closes-Bug: #1271530

commit_message:
Use VIOS wwpns mapped target wwpns and luns

Exposes an interface which allows to build the ITLs
by identifying the exact map of target wwpns and luns based
on vios wwpns.
A new member variable is added which keeps track of
the number of vioses on which the hdisk is discovered and
connected successfully.

Change-Id: I2957811a22e637b7110fd13dd006c95370900b46

commit_message:
Fix oslo.messaging in neutron-server

oslo.messaging is breaking neutron-server or vice-versa. Either way
pinning oslo.messaging to the current stable fixes the issue. When
2.2.1 is stable or the delorean repos fix the issue we can remove the
pinning

Change-Id: I353aba463d0b1e11f4b58e5edd5241a636701172
Closes-Bug: #1483667

commit_message:
Use correct domain to find project

When adding a role to a group and project OSC is mistakenly using the
group_domain to find the project which will fail if the group_domain !=
project_domain.

Change-Id: I4c1bec9b3b183c755be121b91f40e026d707192b
Closes-Bug: #1483520

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-11 11:51:53.000000000', 'files': ['config.mk'], 'message': 'Allow to change root path for upstream ubuntu mirror

MIRROR_UBUNTU_ROOT=/pkgs/ubuntu is local copy of upstream ubuntu
mirror. We need to provide an ability to change this value while
using any other upstream mirrors, for example:
	MIRROR_UBUNTU_ROOT= \
	MIRROR_UBUNTU=ua.archive.ubuntu.com \
	MIRROR_MOS_UBUNTU=mirror.fuel-infra.org \
		make show-ubuntu-sandbox-repos

Change-Id: I30a74df5ebb4b3ca699fe692c6c076061328208e
'}]
commit_message:
Allow to change root path for upstream ubuntu mirror

MIRROR_UBUNTU_ROOT=/pkgs/ubuntu is local copy of upstream ubuntu
mirror. We need to provide an ability to change this value while
using any other upstream mirrors, for example:
	MIRROR_UBUNTU_ROOT= \
	MIRROR_UBUNTU=ua.archive.ubuntu.com \
	MIRROR_MOS_UBUNTU=mirror.fuel-infra.org \
		make show-ubuntu-sandbox-repos

Change-Id: I30a74df5ebb4b3ca699fe692c6c076061328208e

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-08-07 01:23:41.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/managers.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/common/exceptions.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_extension_driver_api.py'], 'message': 'Pass the extension driver exception to plugin

The extension driver is intercepted by driver manager currently. It will
cover the errors/exceptions happened in extension drivers. The extension
process will continue even if preceding extension driver get a wrong/useless
extended result, or even no result.
This patch make process_[create|update]_<resource>() and
extend_<resource>_dict() methods return the exception, and log it with proper
level respectively, and also include a minor optimization for the
extend_<resource>_dict() methods.

Change-Id: I20a249c47b58292125476bc44b2372ca959509e3
Closes-Bug: #1468990
'}]
commit_message:
Pass the extension driver exception to plugin

The extension driver is intercepted by driver manager currently. It will
cover the errors/exceptions happened in extension drivers. The extension
process will continue even if preceding extension driver get a wrong/useless
extended result, or even no result.
This patch make process_[create|update]_<resource>() and
extend_<resource>_dict() methods return the exception, and log it with proper
level respectively, and also include a minor optimization for the
extend_<resource>_dict() methods.

Change-Id: I20a249c47b58292125476bc44b2372ca959509e3
Closes-Bug: #1468990

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-10 08:36:50.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_dhcp.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py'], 'message': 'Avoid dhcp_release for ipv6 addresses

dhcp_release is only supported for IPv4 addresses [1] and not for
IPv6 addresses [2]. There will be no effect when it is called with
IPv6 address. This patch adds a corresponding note and avoids calling
dhcp_release for IPv6 addresses.

[1] http://manpages.ubuntu.com/manpages/trusty/man1/dhcp_release.1.html
[2] http://lists.thekelleys.org.uk/pipermail/dnsmasq-discuss/2013q2/007084.html

Change-Id: I8b8316c9d3d011c2a687a3a1e2a4da5cf1b5d604
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid dhcp_release for ipv6 addresses

dhcp_release is only supported for IPv4 addresses [1] and not for
IPv6 addresses [2]. There will be no effect when it is called with
IPv6 address. This patch adds a corresponding note and avoids calling
dhcp_release for IPv6 addresses.

[1] http://manpages.ubuntu.com/manpages/trusty/man1/dhcp_release.1.html
[2] http://lists.thekelleys.org.uk/pipermail/dnsmasq-discuss/2013q2/007084.html

Change-Id: I8b8316c9d3d011c2a687a3a1e2a4da5cf1b5d604

commit_message:
Adds apply button to unsaved changes dialog

Introduces unsavedChangesMixin to pages where unsaved changes might
be lost. When these cases detected user gets a dialog
prompting to Cancel/Discard/Save their changes.

Change-Id: I3d370ed1fecdf35d70de98b09c00fc3d96a8d122
Closes-Bug: #1428633
Closes-Bug: #1340353
Closes-Bug: #1441093

commit_message:
ObjectListBase support append and __delitem__

Adds support to nova.objects.base.ObjectListBase for the append() and
__delitem__() methods, which essentially pass through to the underlying
list of objects.

Change-Id: I5bd8e028e1d12f2c71b780d654dfd8f401f110d7

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7225, 'name': 'Serg Melikyan', 'email': 'smelikyan@mirantis.com', 'username': 'smelikyan'}, {'_account_id': 8127, 'name': 'Alexander Tivelkov', 'email': 'locher@yandex.ru', 'username': 'ativelkov'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-10 17:25:02.000000000', 'files': ['yaql/standard_library/legacy.py', 'yaql/standard_library/strings.py'], 'message': 'Makes len(string) be extension method

'}]
commit_message:
Makes len(string) be extension method

It was possible to say both len(collection)
and collection.len() and the same goes for dicts
but no string.len().

Now len(string) can be used as both function and
method

Change-Id: Idc725b4c806de9298c3e1b89ba07500ebefa6f9a

commit_message:
Better exception messages

When method is not found doesn't match supplied arguments
object representation should be logged instead of just its type
as the cause is not necessary object type

Change-Id: I84bd816b9963febee8fa31c7fba6ce4b1a878a6e

subject: *args/**kwargs were added to SmartType methods
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7225, 'name': 'Serg Melikyan', 'email': 'smelikyan@mirantis.com', 'username': 'smelikyan'}, {'_account_id': 8127, 'name': 'Alexander Tivelkov', 'email': 'locher@yandex.ru', 'username': 'ativelkov'}, {'_account_id': 15168, 'name': 'Kirill Zaitsev', 'email': 'k.zaitsev@me.com', 'username': 'kzaitsev'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-08-04 08:52:33.000000000', 'files': ['yaql/language/yaqltypes.py'], 'message': '*args/**kwargs were added to SmartType methods

It is likely that next yaql version may have additional parameters
to check/convert methods. But it is impossible to add parameter
without breaking old inheritors that do not expect those parameters.
The only solution is to add *args/**kwargs to each method from the
start so that old functions will just ignore new parameters

Change-Id: I2b95a5111366ab488a7a9e3223481cc5579395ef
'}]
commit_message:
*args/**kwargs were added to SmartType methods

It is likely that next yaql version may have additional parameters
to check/convert methods. But it is impossible to add parameter
without breaking old inheritors that do not expect those parameters.
The only solution is to add *args/**kwargs to each method from the
start so that old functions will just ignore new parameters

Change-Id: I2b95a5111366ab488a7a9e3223481cc5579395ef

subject: Make data converters extendable
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7225, 'name': 'Serg Melikyan', 'email': 'smelikyan@mirantis.com', 'username': 'smelikyan'}, {'_account_id': 8127, 'name': 'Alexander Tivelkov', 'email': 'locher@yandex.ru', 'username': 'ativelkov'}, {'_account_id': 15168, 'name': 'Kirill Zaitsev', 'email': 'k.zaitsev@me.com', 'username': 'kzaitsev'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-04 08:47:53.000000000', 'files': ['yaql/language/utils.py'], 'message': 'Make data converters extendable

Add optional parameter to utils.convert_input()
and utils.convert_output_data() representing function
that need to be called recursively. By default it will
be the version from utils. But consumers may write
extended versions of those functions that do additional
conversion and then call original function passing themselves
in added parameter so that those additional conversions be
used for nested structures as well

Change-Id: Iff7dadf4a12a163676012baaa85292e3d3e8bedc
'}]
commit_message:
Make data converters extendable

Add optional parameter to utils.convert_input()
and utils.convert_output_data() representing function
that need to be called recursively. By default it will
be the version from utils. But consumers may write
extended versions of those functions that do additional
conversion and then call original function passing themselves
in added parameter so that those additional conversions be
used for nested structures as well

Change-Id: Iff7dadf4a12a163676012baaa85292e3d3e8bedc

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7225, 'name': 'Serg Melikyan', 'email': 'smelikyan@mirantis.com', 'username': 'smelikyan'}, {'_account_id': 8127, 'name': 'Alexander Tivelkov', 'email': 'locher@yandex.ru', 'username': 'ativelkov'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-03 23:13:06.000000000', 'files': ['yaql/tests/test_contexts.py', 'yaql/language/contexts.py', 'yaql/language/yaqltypes.py'], 'message': 'Contexts interface refactoring

* Added methods to retrieve context keys, check data/function
   presence, delete data/function
* Recursion was eliminated
* collect_functions() was moved to the base class and uses inheritors
   get_functions() API
* Bugs in MultiContext were fixed
* Unit tests were added

Change-Id: Ibe3a1345546d1c44df55d02e6e3408ac0325e99a
'}]
commit_message:
Contexts interface refactoring

* Added methods to retrieve context keys, check data/function
   presence, delete data/function
* Recursion was eliminated
* collect_functions() was moved to the base class and uses inheritors
   get_functions() API
* Bugs in MultiContext were fixed
* Unit tests were added

commit_message:
Align requirements to Kilo's global requirements

To prevent some of the bugs that we have due to
conflicts in requirements, upper versions from Kilo's
global requirements were used.
RPM spec was also updated.

Change-Id: I37253e700bd6c7c1b409f20f4c422056eac2bf13
Closes-Bug: #1483203

commit_message:
remove Zabbix experimental feature because it has been moved to a fuel plugin

this change is a part of a set of changes:

fuel-library: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/182615/
fuel-main: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/182682/
fuel-web: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/182701/

Closes-Bug: #1455664
Change-Id: I701af0d97ed50fab3b6299cb607c1b6ea7319aa5

fuel-main: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/182682/
fuel-web: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/182701/

Closes-Bug: #1455664
Change-Id: I3d3d89aaa38a515d32757c0ccd0aa86afab51db1

commit_message:
Add coordination util for service management

Tooz is a Python library that provides a coordination API. Its primary
goal is to handle groups and membership of these groups in distributed
systems.

This patch adds coordination util to Mistral, which makes use of Tooz
libary.

Change-Id: Icbf3086d01649af813727f0972d6d5b0631d6afb
Partially-Implements: blueprint mistral-service-api

subject: Glance bootstrap container does not create tables and runs forever
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1390, 'name': 'Paul Bourke', 'email': 'pauldbourke@proton.me', 'username': 'pauldbourke'}, {'_account_id': 14119, 'name': 'Sam Yaple', 'email': 'sam+git@yaple.net', 'username': 'SamYaple'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-11 10:58:34.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/glance/tasks/bootstrap.yml'], 'message': 'Glance bootstrap container does not create tables and runs forever

Due to typo in ansible/roles/glance/tasks/bootstrap.yml container
misses database initialization block and starts service instead.
Ansible hangs on waiting for bootstrap container exit.

Change-Id: Icf5ba68b47d65b22d6869e4b7b2d93e7edb8ed3b
Closes-Bug: #1483647
'}]
commit_message:
Glance bootstrap container does not create tables and runs forever

Due to typo in ansible/roles/glance/tasks/bootstrap.yml container
misses database initialization block and starts service instead.
Ansible hangs on waiting for bootstrap container exit.

Change-Id: Icf5ba68b47d65b22d6869e4b7b2d93e7edb8ed3b
Closes-Bug: #1483647

commit_message:
Support configuring remote ip to ETCD server

This patch enable etcd clients to define remote ip
for connecting to the etcd server.
both from the plugin and from the df-controller

Change-Id: I2d693913537ea4f4c48ddd9eb1dadb8a87d276da

commit_message:
VPNaaS: Enable devstack plugin for tests

Now that the VPNaaS repo has a devstack plugin, we need to
(apparently :) enable it for tests, before removing VPN
related setup from the devstack repo.

Change-Id: I72af2d48f58d885f8872b149517c7fabe6ec8cf7

commit_message:
Remove duplicate code to load client

Since both the core plugin, l3, lbaas and in the future, ML2 driver all
need to initialize the midonet client the same way, move the loading
method to a common module to avoid code duplication.

Change-Id: Iea4d6fc607436e69ab9913639bfe688e42b67ab4
Partially-Implements: bp/midonet-ml2
Signed-off-by: Ryu Ishimoto <ryu@midokura.com>

commit_message:
Speed up reaper for a big account delete and some better error handling

In run_forever mode, run the reaper on all three copies of the account
DB instead of just the first one and shard the containers between them.

Change-Id: Id182e89dad70df9d6d9988523861b8085d74c765

commit_message:
Change ansible forks used

This patch changes the number of forks used by ansible when
using any of the convenience (and thus gate check) scripts
to the number of processors available on the deployment
system.

The previous values used were found to cause ssh connection
errors and it was found that reducing the number improved
the chances of success.

This patch also removes the forks setting from ansible.conf
so that ansible will use the default value when run in any
other way. This leaves the decision of setting the number
of forks to the deployer, as it should be.

Change-Id: I31ad7353344f7994063127ecfce8f4733769234c
Closes-Bug: #1479812
(cherry picked from commit 7b10c64007a14e78b52b0afcfc2fa2f7b4e17ef3)

commit_message:
Added gate process and more logs

This adds a forced apt update for packages and keys which is intended to help
with the HPB4 gate issues. This also creates logs for all ansible commands
run in the gate process.

Change-Id: I79b64567e615d83c52c1a8727082345ffe265c87
(cherry picked from commit a86d89f1a7b1d957130f6278363e693197aedb48)

There is no (general) use case to allow users to configure qos driver to

commit_message:
Removed configuration option for qos agent driver selection

There is no (general) use case to allow users to configure qos driver to
load by qos l2 agent extension. So instead of getting the driver name
from the configuration file, hardcode it and potentially reuse for other
extensions that may also be interested in splitting extension into
agent agnostic and agent specific pieces.

Added driver_type parameter to AgentCoreResourceExtension.initialize().
Also updated the method signature to reflect that we expect l2
extensions to receive connection.

Finally, removed #noqa import for openvswitch.common.config from qos
extension unit test since it seems unneeded.

Change-Id: Iae4dcc20c967d1da216772a3a3660e0421263527
Partially-Implements: quantum-qos-api

commit_message:
Change max_connection size parameter for MySQL

Change max_connection size parameter for MySQL. This parameter is
calculated based on RAM and MySQL buffers, with upper bound to
8192 and lower bound to 1000 connections.

Co-Authored-By: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>

DocImpact: ops-guide
Change-Id: Ie5945d65f211b6ea074c69b080bba6b9dfad60b2
Related-bug: #1475433

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 6537, 'name': 'gordon chung', 'email': 'gord@live.ca', 'username': 'chungg'}, {'_account_id': 9562, 'name': 'Ildiko Vancsa', 'email': 'ildiko.vancsa@gmail.com', 'username': 'ildikov'}, {'_account_id': 15843, 'name': 'Intel Hardware-Meters CI', 'email': 'ipmi-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'ipmici'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-10 08:52:45.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/api/middleware.py', 'ceilometer/api/hooks.py'], 'message': "Correct thread handling in TranslationHook

TranslationHook was using a threading.local() to store an error
message however the threading.local() was being created in __init__
of the Hook. Hooks are not per request, so this wasn't really
working as planned.

Now, instead of using threading.local() at all, we just modify the
environ held by pecan (and later used by the
ParsableErrorMiddleware). environ is request-local.

This change feels a bit crufty because it is but because of the way
Exceptions are managed in the app there's not really any good way to do
it. We could consider changing the way Exceptions related to error
messages, but that would be a very large change.

Duplicated from similar change in aodh:
I463059df28f291cea0644b1a9908a907f146ba1f

Change-Id: Ie561ec7ee7ec8b6d4a535ba7b20569b5a1101878
Closes-Bug: #1481244
"}]
commit_message:
Correct thread handling in TranslationHook

TranslationHook was using a threading.local() to store an error
message however the threading.local() was being created in __init__
of the Hook. Hooks are not per request, so this wasn't really
working as planned.

Now, instead of using threading.local() at all, we just modify the
environ held by pecan (and later used by the
ParsableErrorMiddleware). environ is request-local.

This change feels a bit crufty because it is but because of the way
Exceptions are managed in the app there's not really any good way to do
it. We could consider changing the way Exceptions related to error
messages, but that would be a very large change.

Duplicated from similar change in aodh:
I463059df28f291cea0644b1a9908a907f146ba1f

Change-Id: Ie561ec7ee7ec8b6d4a535ba7b20569b5a1101878
Closes-Bug: #1481244

commit_message:
Add dependency on both keystone backends for Sahara

During creating Sahara templates both Keystone backends may be
unnavailable and we need add dependency on both backends.
Additional commit for Idf07556d229d7c656106ac749053bd474e5d5a47

Change-Id: I20d96feadc5efebddf758ff9370c8ec4941eb9e7
Closes-bug: #1479782

commit_message:
Use DeferredOVSBridge in setup_default_table

setup_default_table method in br-tun module fires multiple ofctl
calls. Using DeferredOVSBridge will help us save us few OVS calls.

Closes-Bug: #1259847

Change-Id: I2f01bae5d9efc5c6a6f577e92204c930eb1cf827

commit_message:
Add delete_port api to agent extension manager

This commit add delete_port api to the agent
extension manager, the agent extension and the qos
etension, and it update the ovs agent to call it upon
delete port.

Change-Id: Ia4e96c7c734cf4abe9a35c813bd8330b15b68f4c
Partially-Implements: bluerint ml2-qos

commit_message:
Increase Haproxy checks timeouts for MySQL/Galera

Haproxy backend has been adjusted to check galera backend via
galeracheck script every 20 seconds instead of 15. In HA scenario, 3
servers will call galeracheck every 5-7 seconds. When server is down
haproxy will call every 2 seconds instead of one

Co-Authored-By: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Ibd1a9a53a9e98e1989b04475c7dc6a01339ba2e0
Related-bug: #1475433

commit_message:
Add test case for LoadBalancer driver(2)

This patch completed the test case of LoadBalancer driver which
uses Neutron LBaaS as backend service. It also added a get_current
method in Senlin context module which actually invokes the
get_current method defined in oslo_context.

Change-Id: I8e5ab4c09f88ce52406187aa6e8fca7483934117
Closes-Bug: #1472852

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-10 13:09:48.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/nailgun/manifests/cobbler.pp'], 'message': "Ubuntu bootstrap: reboot on boot failure

By default the initramfs starts an interactive shell if the root
filesystem image can't be downloaded. This behaviour is not suitable
for Fuel, so tell the initramfs to reboot.

Related-Bug: #1483188
Change-Id: I8c166de0b944dbbe1f5ea17641e2dbda90d97116
"}]
commit_message:
Ubuntu bootstrap: reboot on boot failure

By default the initramfs starts an interactive shell if the root
filesystem image can't be downloaded. This behaviour is not suitable
for Fuel, so tell the initramfs to reboot.

Related-Bug: #1483188
Change-Id: I8c166de0b944dbbe1f5ea17641e2dbda90d97116

commit_message:
Refactor api tests for alarm history

This patch fixs a input of the helper function '_get_alarm_history()'
which used to get alarm data although it just referred 'alarm_id'.

This patch also delete unecessary '_get_alarm()'.

'print' function is compatible with 2.x and 3.x python versions
Link : https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105/

Python 2.6 has a __future__ import that removes print as language syntax,

"}]
commit_message:
test/unit: Replace python print operator with print function (pep H233, py33)

'print' function is compatible with 2.x and 3.x python versions
Link : https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105/

Python 2.6 has a __future__ import that removes print as language syntax,
letting you use the functional form instead

Change-Id: I94e1bc6bd83ad6b05695c7ebdf7cbfd8f6d9f9af

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7549, 'name': 'Ekaterina Chernova', 'email': 'katyafervent@yandex.ru', 'username': 'efedorova'}, {'_account_id': 7821, 'name': 'Murano CI', 'username': 'murano-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13962, 'name': 'Victor Ryzhenkin', 'email': 'vryzhenkin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vryzhenkin'}, {'_account_id': 15168, 'name': 'Kirill Zaitsev', 'email': 'k.zaitsev@me.com', 'username': 'kzaitsev'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-10 22:49:56.000000000', 'files': ['meta/io.murano/Classes/resources/NeutronNetwork.yaml'], 'message': 'default_dns from config was never used

NeutronNetwork class was comparing $.dnsNameservers to
null and only then using config parameters. However property
with list contract cannot be null as null (or missing) value will be
converted to empty list

Change-Id: Icc920e8979005446faf5c69eb9f22a1e8b7f054e
Closes-Bug: #1483428
'}]
commit_message:
default_dns from config was never used

NeutronNetwork class was comparing $.dnsNameservers to
null and only then using config parameters. However property
with list contract cannot be null as null (or missing) value will be
converted to empty list

Change-Id: Icc920e8979005446faf5c69eb9f22a1e8b7f054e
Closes-Bug: #1483428

commit_message:
Functional test for QoS policy bandwidth rule update

Creates a port in a policy, and subsequently modifies the
bandwidth limit rule in the policy, then verifies that the
new limits are assigned to the port.

Change-Id: I23fe45ef08618ad91567feb1707028e0a0bfe0d6
Partially-Implements: ml2-qos

commit_message:
make devstack up-to-date for Liberty

In this patch:

 * Correct network extensions are enabled for tempest
 * Unnecessary configurations are removed
 * Q_L3_ENABLED is moved to setting from functions

Change-Id: Iad84140093443519e9f3cee708d6a55cb50c8337
Partially-Implements: bp/clean-up-devstack-plugin
Signed-off-by: Ryu Ishimoto <ryu@midokura.com>

commit_message:
Top Nav is responsive and inherits from its theme

Horizon's top nav now uses <nav> and correcly implements
the Bootstrap HTML standards to make a responsive experience.

Partially-Implements: blueprint horizon-theme-css-reorg
Partially-Implements: blueprint bootstrap-html-standards

Change-Id: I73c5529ae477a17f10a17946ac7120969578a0ba

commit_message:
WIP: Follow Docker official guide to optimize Dockerfile

* Change ADD command to COPY
* Merge multi ADD/COPY commands to a single command
* Reduce image layers and size by merge Dockerfile commands
* Link: http://docs.docker.com/reference/builder/

Change-Id: I0442900b2aa54b98fa47206f5e6c5741a67ce1a6

commit_message:
StorPool: clean up the last uses of str.format()

Replace three logging uses of str.format() with parameters passed
directly to LOG.error(), simplifying them in the process by
avoiding the need to call six.text_type() ourselves.

Replace the remaining use with string concatenation.

Suggested by: Sean McGinnis in review 188725
Change-Id: Ie53c394d7f31fa1dccfa4ed5c4b514539c77aa05

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-10 13:32:48.000000000', 'files': ['meta/io.murano/Classes/Environment.yaml'], 'message': "Removes early creation of Heat stack

Murano environment deployment started with empty stack
creation so that it can be done prior to keystone token expiration
for Heat to establish trusts based on user's token.
When environment does nothing with the stack (for example
all environment applications are HOT based and deploy into their
own stacks) empty stack remains. Because most applications
start their deployment with instance/other resources deployment

"}]
commit_message:
Removes early creation of Heat stack

Murano environment deployment started with empty stack
creation so that it can be done prior to keystone token expiration
for Heat to establish trusts based on user's token.
When environment does nothing with the stack (for example
all environment applications are HOT based and deploy into their
own stacks) empty stack remains. Because most applications
start their deployment with instance/other resources deployment
stack will be created early anyway. So this strategy is redundant.

Change-Id: Id8ec1df2c83f540b272ef70bd054f70de9da7715
Closes-Bug: #1473129
(cherry picked from commit fc586b949d489343de9894ec92d21990f65a1e32)

commit_message:
Sahara Shell Action Form

Sahara is implementing a new Shell Action job type, specified at
add-edp-shell-action. Reviews for this feature are at:

- https://review.openstack.org/156795
- https://review.openstack.org/159920

This task will add options and help text to support this job type
in the job creation form (at
openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/data_processing/jobs).

Change-Id: Iba70e78d51db943952c53ae44629f02e0903864b
Implements: blueprint sahara-shell-action-form

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 6968, 'name': 'Christian Schwede', 'email': 'cschwede@redhat.com', 'username': 'cschwede'}, {'_account_id': 10607, 'name': 'Alexandra Settle', 'email': 'a.settle@outlook.com', 'username': 'asettle'}, {'_account_id': 12974, 'name': 'Ben Martin', 'email': 'blmartin@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'blmartin'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15932, 'name': 'Bill Huber', 'email': 'wbhuber@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'wbhuber'}, {'_account_id': 16206, 'name': 'chenhuayi', 'email': 'chenhuayi@huawei.com', 'username': 'chenhuayi2'}, {'_account_id': 17276, 'name': 'Carlos Cavanna', 'email': 'ccavanna@ca.ibm.com', 'username': 'ccavanna'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-08-05 14:29:23.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/deployment_guide.rst', 'doc/source/development_saio.rst', 'doc/source/admin_guide.rst'], 'message': '+Document method to avoid rsync filling root drive

When rsync pushes to a remote node with an unmounted drive and if
certain steps are not taken, rsync may attempt to write files to
the local drive at the location where the drive was mounted.

There are two suggested solutions for this issue:
  1) Set the permissions for all mount points in /srv/node/
       to root:root 755
  2) Mount the drives elsewhere and symlink the drives to /srv/.../

The first method ensures that only root and not the swift user
can write in the /srv/.../ directories.

The second method will prompt a broken link issue if rsync
attempts to write to an unmounted drive.

Change-Id: I60ce4ed9ef8401768d5f78b6806cbb2e2a65303e
Closes-Bug: #1470576
'}]
commit_message:
+Document method to avoid rsync filling root drive

When rsync pushes to a remote node with an unmounted drive and if
certain steps are not taken, rsync may attempt to write files to
the local drive at the location where the drive was mounted.

There are two suggested solutions for this issue:
  1) Set the permissions for all mount points in /srv/node/
       to root:root 755
  2) Mount the drives elsewhere and symlink the drives to /srv/.../

The first method ensures that only root and not the swift user
can write in the /srv/.../ directories.

The second method will prompt a broken link issue if rsync
attempts to write to an unmounted drive.

Change-Id: I60ce4ed9ef8401768d5f78b6806cbb2e2a65303e
Closes-Bug: #1470576

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2015-07-28 13:26:45.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/interface.py'], 'message': "New interface driver for DHCP for routed networking

This change adds an interface driver that combines with the reference
Neutron DHCP agent to provide DHCP service to unbridged TAP interfaces
on the local compute host.  This is what is needed when using a
'routed' network implementation [1] in which data to and from VMs is
routed on the compute host instead of being bridged.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/198439/

Use of this interface driver should be triggered by the following
settings in one of the config files that the DHCP agent reads.

    interface_driver = neutron.agent.linux.interface.RoutedInterfaceDriver
    use_namespaces = False

Key points of its implementation are as follows.

- Everything is done in the default namespace.

- The DHCP agent invokes Dnsmasq with modified options, notably
  '--bridge-interface=ns-XXX,tap* --interface=tap*', that tell Dnsmasq
  to listen on all the TAP interfaces and to treat those interfaces as
  aliases of the ns-XXX interface where the DHCP context and IP subnet
  are defined.

- The ns-XXX interface (for the DHCP port) is created as a dummy
  interface.

- The ns-XXX interface is given the subnet's gateway IP address,
  instead of a freshly allocated IP address from the subnet.

- The on-link route for the subnet, which Linux creates automatically,
  must be deleted, since other addresses on that subnet are not in
  fact available via the dummy device.

Partial-Bug: #1472704
Change-Id: I4dc5ae75f722d079a529ea1ae5f2011a3edbc84e
"}]
commit_message:
New interface driver for DHCP for routed networking

This change adds an interface driver that combines with the reference
Neutron DHCP agent to provide DHCP service to unbridged TAP interfaces
on the local compute host.  This is what is needed when using a
'routed' network implementation [1] in which data to and from VMs is
routed on the compute host instead of being bridged.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/198439/

Use of this interface driver should be triggered by the following
settings in one of the config files that the DHCP agent reads.

    interface_driver = neutron.agent.linux.interface.RoutedInterfaceDriver
    use_namespaces = False

Key points of its implementation are as follows.

- Everything is done in the default namespace.

- The DHCP agent invokes Dnsmasq with modified options, notably
  '--bridge-interface=ns-XXX,tap* --interface=tap*', that tell Dnsmasq
  to listen on all the TAP interfaces and to treat those interfaces as
  aliases of the ns-XXX interface where the DHCP context and IP subnet
  are defined.

- The ns-XXX interface (for the DHCP port) is created as a dummy
  interface.

- The ns-XXX interface is given the subnet's gateway IP address,
  instead of a freshly allocated IP address from the subnet.

- The on-link route for the subnet, which Linux creates automatically,
  must be deleted, since other addresses on that subnet are not in
  fact available via the dummy device.

Partial-Bug: #1472704
Change-Id: I4dc5ae75f722d079a529ea1ae5f2011a3edbc84e

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-08-07 22:35:58.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/images/images/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/static/dashboard/project/workflow/launch-instance/launch-instance-wizard.controller.spec.js', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/static/dashboard/project/workflow/launch-instance/launch-instance-modal.controller.js', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/static/dashboard/project/workflow/launch-instance/launch-instance-modal.controller.spec.js', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/static/dashboard/project/workflow/launch-instance/launch-instance-wizard.controller.js'], 'message': 'JSCS Cleanup - style guide cleanup for Launch Instance wizard

Following John Papa's style guide
https://github.com/johnpapa/angular-styleguide,
this patch refactors the Angular code for Launch Instance wizard.

Note that the construction of the Launch Instance wizard precludes
applying JP's "controller as" rule to the top level wizard controller
itself; doing so breaks the *many* implicit parent accesses throughout
the wizard sub controllers (implicit parent scope accesses are not
possible using the "controller as" style). Fixing that is potentially
a flow-on tech-debt fix that is outside of the scope of this
patch - it'll be a bunch of work!

I also noticed a trivial bugfix while addressing this. It could be
broken out into a separate patch, but we have enough patches already ;)

Change-Id: Ie6a1fdca1da60259adbb65c36a9829b001ae752b
Partially-Implements: blueprint jscs-cleanup
Closes-Bug: 1481135
'}]
commit_message:
JSCS Cleanup - style guide cleanup for Launch Instance wizard

Following John Papa's style guide
https://github.com/johnpapa/angular-styleguide,
this patch refactors the Angular code for Launch Instance wizard.

Note that the construction of the Launch Instance wizard precludes
applying JP's "controller as" rule to the top level wizard controller
itself; doing so breaks the *many* implicit parent accesses throughout
the wizard sub controllers (implicit parent scope accesses are not
possible using the "controller as" style). Fixing that is potentially
a flow-on tech-debt fix that is outside of the scope of this
patch - it'll be a bunch of work!

I also noticed a trivial bugfix while addressing this. It could be
broken out into a separate patch, but we have enough patches already ;)

Change-Id: Ie6a1fdca1da60259adbb65c36a9829b001ae752b
Partially-Implements: blueprint jscs-cleanup
Closes-Bug: 1481135

commit_message:
Improve List Role Assignments Filters Performance

When listing role assignments, we have the option
to filter them by actor, target and role. The
current implementation uses the standard
filtering the V3.wrap_collection. Given the large
number of individual assignments, this is pretty
inefficient.

This patch allows the controller to pass the
filters into the driver call, so the driver
filter the results itself and as result, then the
list size is kept a minimum.

The restful testing that is already in place for
listing assignments will still act as an effective
test, since there is no change to external functionality
with this patch. However, a crucial byproduct of this
change is that follow-on patches can refactor a number
of manager methods related to effective assignments to
simply call this one rather than duplicate the algorithms
around the assignment backend. In order to ensure those
different usage patterns are tested, a separate series
of patches follow this to add manager-level testing of
this new assignment listing capability.

Co-Authored-By: Henry Nash <henryn@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: Rodrigo Duarte <rodrigods@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Implements: bp list-role-assignments-performance

Change-Id: I20569a201f5cd4467a4891920255993c04dccda2

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-08-07 16:08:55.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/fakelibvirt.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: set caps on maximum live migration time

Currently Nova launches live migration and then just leaves it
to run, assuming it'll eventually finish. If the guest is
dirtying memory quicker than the network can transfer it, it
is entirely possible that a migration will never complete. In
such a case it is highly undesirable to leave it running
forever since it wastes valuable CPU and network resources
Rather than trying to come up with a new policy for aborting
migration in OpenStack, copy the existing logic that is
successfully battle tested by the oVirt project in VDSM.

This introduces two new host level configuration parameters
that cloud administrators can use to ensure migrations which
don't appear likely to complete will be aborted. First is
an overall cap on the total running time of migration. The
configured value is scaled by the number of GB of guest RAM,
since larger guests will obviously take proportionally longer
to migrate. The second is a timeout that is applied when Nova
detects that memory is being dirtied faster than it can be
transferred. It tracks a low watermark of data remaining and
if that low watermark doesn't decrease in the given time,
it assumes the VM is stuck and aborts migration

NB with the default values for the config parameters, the code
for detecting stuck migrations is only going to kick in for
guests which have more than 2 GB of RAM allocated, as for
smaller guests the overall time limit will abort migration
before this happens. This is reasonable as small guests are
less likely to get stuck during migration, as the network
will generally be able to keep up with dirtying data well
enough to get to a point where the final switchover can be
performed.

Related-bug: #1429220
DocImpact: two new libvirt configuration parameters in
           nova.conf allow the administrator to control
           length of migration before aborting it
Change-Id: I461affe6c85aaf2a6bf6e8749586bfbfe0ebc146
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: set caps on maximum live migration time

Currently Nova launches live migration and then just leaves it
to run, assuming it'll eventually finish. If the guest is
dirtying memory quicker than the network can transfer it, it
is entirely possible that a migration will never complete. In
such a case it is highly undesirable to leave it running
forever since it wastes valuable CPU and network resources
Rather than trying to come up with a new policy for aborting
migration in OpenStack, copy the existing logic that is
successfully battle tested by the oVirt project in VDSM.

This introduces two new host level configuration parameters
that cloud administrators can use to ensure migrations which
don't appear likely to complete will be aborted. First is
an overall cap on the total running time of migration. The
configured value is scaled by the number of GB of guest RAM,
since larger guests will obviously take proportionally longer
to migrate. The second is a timeout that is applied when Nova
detects that memory is being dirtied faster than it can be
transferred. It tracks a low watermark of data remaining and
if that low watermark doesn't decrease in the given time,
it assumes the VM is stuck and aborts migration

NB with the default values for the config parameters, the code
for detecting stuck migrations is only going to kick in for
guests which have more than 2 GB of RAM allocated, as for
smaller guests the overall time limit will abort migration
before this happens. This is reasonable as small guests are
less likely to get stuck during migration, as the network
will generally be able to keep up with dirtying data well
enough to get to a point where the final switchover can be
performed.

Related-bug: #1429220
DocImpact: two new libvirt configuration parameters in
           nova.conf allow the administrator to control
           length of migration before aborting it
Change-Id: I461affe6c85aaf2a6bf6e8749586bfbfe0ebc146

[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-08-07 16:08:55.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/fakelibvirt.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: support management of downtime during migration

Currently live migration runs with the default maximum downtime
setting defined by QEMU. This is often inadequate to allow
migration of large VMs to ever complete. Rather than trying to
invent a new policy for changing downtime in OpenStack, copy
the existing logic that is successfully battle tested by the
oVirt project in VDSM.

Note that setting the downtime step delay based on guest RAM size
is an inexact science, as RAM size is only one factor influencing
success of migration. Just as important is the rate of dirtying
data in the guest, but this is based on guest workload which is
not something Nova has visibility into. The bottleneck is the
network which needs to be able to keep up with the dirtying of
data in the guest. The greater the overall RAM size, the more
time is required to transfer the total guest memory. So for
larger guest sizes, we need to allow greater time for the guest
to attempt to successfully migrate before increasing the max
downtime. Scaling downtime step delay according to the overall
guest RAM size is a reasonable, albeit not foolproof, way to
tune migration to increase chances of success.

This adds three host level config parameters which admins can
use to control the base downtime value and the rate at which
downtime is allowed to be increased during migration.

Related-bug: #1429220
DocImpact: three new libvirt configuration parameters in
           nova.conf allow the administrator to control
           the maximum permitted downtime for migration
           making migration more likely to complete for
           large VMs.
Change-Id: I1992ffe9d3b2ff8d436cf1c419af9a238a8fecd8
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: support management of downtime during migration

Currently live migration runs with the default maximum downtime
setting defined by QEMU. This is often inadequate to allow
migration of large VMs to ever complete. Rather than trying to
invent a new policy for changing downtime in OpenStack, copy
the existing logic that is successfully battle tested by the
oVirt project in VDSM.

Note that setting the downtime step delay based on guest RAM size
is an inexact science, as RAM size is only one factor influencing
success of migration. Just as important is the rate of dirtying
data in the guest, but this is based on guest workload which is
not something Nova has visibility into. The bottleneck is the
network which needs to be able to keep up with the dirtying of
data in the guest. The greater the overall RAM size, the more
time is required to transfer the total guest memory. So for
larger guest sizes, we need to allow greater time for the guest
to attempt to successfully migrate before increasing the max
downtime. Scaling downtime step delay according to the overall
guest RAM size is a reasonable, albeit not foolproof, way to
tune migration to increase chances of success.

This adds three host level config parameters which admins can
use to control the base downtime value and the rate at which
downtime is allowed to be increased during migration.

Related-bug: #1429220
DocImpact: three new libvirt configuration parameters in
           nova.conf allow the administrator to control
           the maximum permitted downtime for migration
           making migration more likely to complete for
           large VMs.
Change-Id: I1992ffe9d3b2ff8d436cf1c419af9a238a8fecd8

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-07 13:20:15.000000000', 'files': ['tools/split.sh'], 'message': 'Remove quotes from subshell call in tools/split.sh

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code in split.sh, only to use a
better code style.

Change-Id: Ib86d59e10be0aca4774ad2fc656915a96b1b6c74
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove quotes from subshell call in tools/split.sh

Always no quotes for $() statement.

We don't need quotes to hold blanks in result:
 # i=$(echo 1 2 3)
 # echo $i
 1 2 3
 #

These quotes can make something wrong in some case:
 # i=$(echo '!')
 #
 # i="$(echo '!')"
 -bash: !: event not found
 #

No real problem for current code in split.sh, only to use a
better code style.

Change-Id: Ib86d59e10be0aca4774ad2fc656915a96b1b6c74
Signed-off-by: Zhao Lei <zhaolei@cn.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Remove 'rabbitmq-plugins' package in ha-guide

The package 'rabbitmq-plugins' is not a package on Ubuntu/Debian,
the rabbitmq-plugins script is available when the 'rabbitmq-server'
package is installed, so remove 'rabbitmq-plugins' package for the
On Ubuntu and Debian part in OpenStack High Availability Guide.

Closes-Bug: #1382092

Change-Id: Id58c5eb105394ab849d2b2bdec7ff2ec9f78fc63

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-07 10:36:00.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_l3.py'], 'message': "Make '_create_router' function handle Boolean kwargs correctly

The function allows arbitrary kw arguments to be specificed.
Those kw arguments whose key is specified in the function
parameter 'arg_list' are then passed in the create router REST
API call.

The code line that checks if a kw argument key is included in
'arg_list' does not work with Boolean kw arguments. Nor does it
work with None kw argument values. This is a limitation as
tests in inheriting classes may need such kw arguments.

This patch fixes the faulty 'if' clause so that it simply
checks that the kw argument key is in 'arg_list'. This makes it
support Boolean kw arguments and kw arguments with value None.

Closes-Bug: #1482108
Change-Id: I5618dc4d5c803c7614dd1f579db3c79928007fb6
"}]
commit_message:
Make '_create_router' function handle Boolean kwargs correctly

The function allows arbitrary kw arguments to be specificed.
Those kw arguments whose key is specified in the function
parameter 'arg_list' are then passed in the create router REST
API call.

The code line that checks if a kw argument key is included in
'arg_list' does not work with Boolean kw arguments. Nor does it
work with None kw argument values. This is a limitation as
tests in inheriting classes may need such kw arguments.

This patch fixes the faulty 'if' clause so that it simply
checks that the kw argument key is in 'arg_list'. This makes it
support Boolean kw arguments and kw arguments with value None.

Closes-Bug: #1482108
Change-Id: I5618dc4d5c803c7614dd1f579db3c79928007fb6

consistently when run in isolation.

of processes can not be equal 0.

remove branch limiting for ec2api functional jobs.

since ec2api has stable/kilo branch it needs functional tests
for new patchsets to stable/kilo.
So branch limitier has removed from zuul layout.conf in this patchset.

Change-Id: Ib8fba69a640b9d824b1c1165ff4376bbd8910949

commit_message:
Fix ml2 propagation of qos_policy_id removal to agents

Before this, qos_policy_id propagation is not noticed by ml2
due to a bug in the qos core extension.

commit_message:
Update authorization actions for services API

Previously, the services extension used generic authorization check
"volume_extension:services" for both index and update APIs.

This change creates separate rules for index and update APIs
so that it is possible to assign different rules to different users.
The sample /etc/cinder/policy.json is also updated to include new rules:
    "volume_extension:services:index": "",
    "volume_extension:services:update" : "rule:admin_api"

Change-Id: Ib57171f5011210861478590bbdfc30cce25e62b4
Closes-Bug: #1471995
Closes-Bug: #1471999

subject: Using v2password as auth_plugin in nova section of neutron.conf
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8112, 'name': 'Ma Wen Cheng', 'email': 'wenchma@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'wenchma'}, {'_account_id': 9488, 'name': 'chenzhiwei', 'email': 'zhiweik@gmail.com', 'username': 'chenzhiwei'}, {'_account_id': 10486, 'name': 'Song Li', 'email': 'lisongbj@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'sbookworm'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-05-29 07:28:06.000000000', 'files': ['attributes/default.rb', 'spec/default_spec.rb'], 'message': "Using v2password as auth_plugin in nova section of neutron.conf

As Neutron is using keystone v2 authentication method, while
Neutron cookbook is using 'password' as the default auth_plugin
which using v1 authentication. To avoid users facing problems
using the default cookbook to address the nova configuration
refactors in neutron.conf, set the v2password as the default
auth_plugin.

Refer bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-chef/+bug/1449058

Closes-bug: #1459938

Change-Id: Iafe732bd634eddbaccdcc5350595c2e60f44502d
"}]
commit_message:
Using v2password as auth_plugin in nova section of neutron.conf

As Neutron is using keystone v2 authentication method, while
Neutron cookbook is using 'password' as the default auth_plugin
which using v1 authentication. To avoid users facing problems
using the default cookbook to address the nova configuration
refactors in neutron.conf, set the v2password as the default
auth_plugin.

Refer bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-chef/+bug/1449058

Closes-bug: #1459938

Change-Id: Iafe732bd634eddbaccdcc5350595c2e60f44502d

commit_message:
Enable the same log + console uploading as the anvil-rpm builder

The rpm builder logs are being uploaded just fine, which is great
for debugging and figuring out issues, so we should do the same
in the venv building component as well (since the logs can be just
as useful there to).

Currently if an image has not even been described, but a user gets its
id (from describe instance results for example), describe image with
selective filter operation will fail with InvalidAMIIDNotFound
exception.

The reason is that the mapping db object (id-os_id pair) is created, but
has no project_id set. Project_id was unknown when the mapping was being
