Change-Id: I80dacdf4d3d7c317c3e96a6f0d45923e41cc5a40
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the first describing of an alien image by id

Currently if an image has not even been described, but a user gets its
id (from describe instance results for example), describe image with
selective filter operation will fail with InvalidAMIIDNotFound
exception.

The reason is that the mapping db object (id-os_id pair) is created, but
has no project_id set. Project_id was unknown when the mapping was being
created. So both requests to db by current project and for public
objects do not get this mapping.

Change-Id: I80dacdf4d3d7c317c3e96a6f0d45923e41cc5a40

commit_message:
Extend db_api.get_items_ids to search by ec2 ids

db_api.get_items_ids return id mappings (id-os_id pairs) for specified
filters. Currently it doesn't allow filters by ec2 ids. This reduces its
scope of usage.

Change-Id: Ib855429dc2fc650ef7ecff07c637b8d4b45a07db

commit_message:
Validate updated allocation pool before using it

The allocation pool specified during subnet-update is being
used in gateway validation checks before the allocation pool
is ever validated.  Errors indicating that the gateway IP is
invalid are returned when it is the allocation pool that is
actually in error.

Additional testing of the allocation pool is also being added
to the subnet-update unit tests.

Closes-Bug: #1479948
Change-Id: I854333d571bad2550ea5a0b93ff64ce44d0bd010

This fix let DHCP scheduler not looks at only active agents, but all
available agents.
This helps db module to remove dead agent, when rebinding, properly.

Change-Id: I8534ddfae299724c05641183c2fe4c1c98c614e8
Closes-Bug: 1388698
'}]
commit_message:
Bug-Fix for unexpected DHCP agent redundant

This fix let DHCP scheduler not looks at only active agents, but all
available agents.
This helps db module to remove dead agent, when rebinding, properly.

Change-Id: I8534ddfae299724c05641183c2fe4c1c98c614e8
Closes-Bug: 1388698

commit_message:
Use oslo.log library instead of system logging module

The constants of log levels were added in the 1.8 version of
the oslo.log library. So we can replace all usage of system
logging module with log module from oslo.log.

Change-Id: I2992df0bec6337aefa8a75d4853b132bd134fa42
Related-Bug: 1481370

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-07 15:29:43.000000000', 'files': ['glance/api/v2/images.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v2/test_images_resource.py'], 'message': "Make 'id' a read only property for v2

Currently updating 'id' via v2 api returns 200 and inserts a new id
property in the user defined properties. This change makes the 'id'
behaviour consistent with other read only properties ie. size and owner.

Change-Id: Id728be86bc5a8f768a5687cb5c52054c8ed232ac
Closes-bug: 1439808
"}]
commit_message:
Make 'id' a read only property for v2

Currently updating 'id' via v2 api returns 200 and inserts a new id
property in the user defined properties. This change makes the 'id'
behaviour consistent with other read only properties ie. size and owner.

Change-Id: Id728be86bc5a8f768a5687cb5c52054c8ed232ac
Closes-bug: 1439808

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-10 04:00:57.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_stack_collect_attributes.py'], 'message': 'Fix test_stack_collect_attributes

Note: self.stack.resources returns an iterator that is assumed
to be a collection.

Initialize the iterator within the loop otherwise we do not assert
all the resources (mostly only the last one).

Change-Id: Idde2ed6971994438cbfb1f68a80e2816eb8cec54
'}]
commit_message:
Fix test_stack_collect_attributes

Note: self.stack.resources returns an iterator that is assumed
to be a collection.

Initialize the iterator within the loop otherwise we do not assert
all the resources (mostly only the last one).

Change-Id: Idde2ed6971994438cbfb1f68a80e2816eb8cec54

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-01 09:53:37.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/ssc_cmode.py'], 'message': "NetApp SSC job will be run periodically

NetApp cDOT driver is supposed to run SSC job at intervals of 1800
seconds. However, after SSC job ran when cinder-volume services
were started, SSC job does not run again.
The driver should use 'is_older_than' method of oslo_utils to
confirm 1800 seconds passed from last SSC job.

Change-Id: I9d975f66295b75e3bfda47c56bbb11de0e9bf6d0
Closes-Bug: #1478432
"}]
commit_message:
NetApp SSC job will be run periodically

NetApp cDOT driver is supposed to run SSC job at intervals of 1800
seconds. However, after SSC job ran when cinder-volume services
were started, SSC job does not run again.
The driver should use 'is_older_than' method of oslo_utils to
confirm 1800 seconds passed from last SSC job.

Change-Id: I9d975f66295b75e3bfda47c56bbb11de0e9bf6d0
Closes-Bug: #1478432

commit_message:
Remove unused context parameter

Context parameter is removed from cinder methods
which are not using it at all.

Removed 'notification' method from volume/manager.py as it is
not getting used anywhere.

Change-Id: I2ecfdabb876485ac0c0d1cacd6778408be061fc8
Closes-Bug: #1458844

The DEFAULT/os_region_name config option was deprecated in Juno and
replaced with cinder/os_region_name.  The DEFAULT/os_region_name
parameter was removed in Kilo and only the new option remains.

This should be backported to the Kilo branch and probably Juno branch.

'}]
commit_message:
Move os_region_name config option

The DEFAULT/os_region_name config option was deprecated in Juno and
replaced with cinder/os_region_name.  The DEFAULT/os_region_name
parameter was removed in Kilo and only the new option remains.

This should be backported to the Kilo branch and probably Juno branch.

Change-Id: I1b787d53e1c9a9996dd86b2fae263cf62dd2219a

commit_message:
tenant_id implies all_tenants for servers list

Bump the api version to 2.11 make tenant_id imply all_tenants is enabled
unless explicitly disabled when a request is made for a list of servers.
This only occurs if the requestor is an admin.

This review is merged in https://review.openstack.org/52919 and reverted
in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/145687/ for compatible reason.

Co-Authored-By: Chris Yeoh <cyeoh@au1.ibm.com>
Change-Id: Ia4f6021e8abc9ec683c51f5705a2b0389b2a9d71
Closes-Bug: 1185290

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-10 12:48:36.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/common/glance_http.py'], 'message': 'Fixed invalid error message

In setcontext() method of tempest/common/glance_http
module, error message is not formatted property which
leads to error "TypeError: not all arguments converted
during string formatting".

Added appropriate format specifiers to avoid error.

Closes-Bug: 1483230
Change-Id: I48a1f7bf45f563de5959e97ff43b1bc2845feb9f
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed invalid error message

In setcontext() method of tempest/common/glance_http
module, error message is not formatted property which
leads to error "TypeError: not all arguments converted
during string formatting".

Added appropriate format specifiers to avoid error.

Closes-Bug: 1483230
Change-Id: I48a1f7bf45f563de5959e97ff43b1bc2845feb9f

commit_message:
Use docker-engine in setup_gate

The fedora version of docker is hacked by Red Hat to have specific
features which we don't want in the gating.  Use the pristine
upstream version from Docker Inc.

Change-Id: Ied219bc3868176f541083e9d42cde7d6cdeeb71d
Partially-Implements: blueprint gate-source-builds

subject: Fixing Radware LBaaS v2 driver bugs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6951, 'name': 'Brandon Logan', 'email': 'brandon.logan@rackspace.com', 'username': 'brandon-logan'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9828, 'name': 'Radware CI', 'email': 'openstack3rdpartytesting@radware.com', 'username': 'radware3rdpartytesting', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10980, 'name': 'Doug Wiegley', 'email': 'dougwig@parkside.io', 'username': 'dougw'}, {'_account_id': 12403, 'name': 'Al Miller', 'email': 'al.miller@ajmiller.net', 'username': 'ajmiller'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-31 11:06:25.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/drivers/radware/v2_driver.py', 'neutron_lbaas/drivers/radware/base_v2_driver.py'], 'message': "Fixing Radware LBaaS v2 driver bugs

1.
LBaaS v2 Radware driver creates proxy port on member's network if member is located on different than LB network.
It should remove it when LB is deleted.
It also tries to allocate proxy port for any other member located on another different network which is unnecessary

2.
Adding another listener to existing LB does is not reflected in Radware back-end system

3.
When deleting pool without deleting its members first,
the pool is not deleted on backend system, same for HM

Change-Id: I51901c19bde7152658785be5a793f089c33704a9
Closes-Bug: 1479406
"}]
commit_message:
Fixing Radware LBaaS v2 driver bugs

1.
LBaaS v2 Radware driver creates proxy port on member's network if member is located on different than LB network.
It should remove it when LB is deleted.
It also tries to allocate proxy port for any other member located on another different network which is unnecessary

2.
Adding another listener to existing LB does is not reflected in Radware back-end system

3.
When deleting pool without deleting its members first,
the pool is not deleted on backend system, same for HM

Change-Id: I51901c19bde7152658785be5a793f089c33704a9
Closes-Bug: 1479406

LinkLocalAllocator in preparation for adding
FipRulePriorityAllocator as a child class.

commit_message:
Adds the PATCH method to extensions

The URLs registered in extensions support methods like
POST, PUT, GET, DELETE but do not support PATCH method.

Added the PATCH method extensions to the supported
method by via "edit" action.

Change-Id: I7f2386010ab01309cf04084a1f9930fcac478d07
Closes-Bug: #1467500

commit_message:
Replaced port_range_max value with ICMP code

If a Neutron security group rule protocol is ICMP, port_range_max value must be an ICMP code.
Replaced one reference to ICMP type with ICMP code in context of port_range_max.

Closes-Bug: 1483292

Currently, the spec key check will succeed even when the key is
not provided in spec_data. In that case, the statement of
self.spec_data[KEYNAME] could get None as return value which is
unexpected. This patch fixes this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1483154
Change-Id: I65a673344989941f3b64a20854067c807fc7c668
'}]
commit_message:
Check spec key correctly in os.nova.server profile

Currently, the spec key check will succeed even when the key is
not provided in spec_data. In that case, the statement of
self.spec_data[KEYNAME] could get None as return value which is
unexpected. This patch fixes this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1483154
Change-Id: I65a673344989941f3b64a20854067c807fc7c668

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-10 04:24:25.000000000', 'files': ['pbr/git.py'], 'message': 'Handle git being entirely absent

When we try to find the git directory, if git is not present, treat
that the same as an error from git itself. Sadly tests for this are
nearly impossible to meaningfully write, since we always have git
installed. I can do a mock based test if folk want one.

Change-Id: If6160d1fb3def8133bdd0b66105e60ef93f80f82
Closes-Bug: #1481468
'}]
commit_message:
Handle git being entirely absent

When we try to find the git directory, if git is not present, treat
that the same as an error from git itself. Sadly tests for this are
nearly impossible to meaningfully write, since we always have git
installed. I can do a mock based test if folk want one.

Change-Id: If6160d1fb3def8133bdd0b66105e60ef93f80f82
Closes-Bug: #1481468

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-03 11:04:33.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/api/rpc/handlers/dhcp_rpc.py', 'neutron/api/rpc/handlers/l3_rpc.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': "Add oslo db retry decorator to the RPC handlers

The decorator was previously added at the API layer
(commit 4e77442d529d9803ff90de905b846af940eaf382,
commit d04335c448aa15cf9e1902e22ed4cd17b6ed344b).
However some RPC handlers are also dealing with port
create/update/delete operations, like dhcp ports for example.
We need to cover these cases too.

Also remove db retry from ml2 plugin delete_port()
as it's not needed once we retry at the API and RPC layers.
(there is already a unit test on this)

The patch also adds a unit test for checking deadlock
handling during port creation at API layer.
Though it's not directly related to the current fix,
I decided to leave it for regression preventing purposes.

Closes-Bug: #1479738
Change-Id: I7793a8f7c37ca542b8bc12372168aaaa0826ac4c
"}]
commit_message:
Add oslo db retry decorator to the RPC handlers

The decorator was previously added at the API layer
(commit 4e77442d529d9803ff90de905b846af940eaf382,
commit d04335c448aa15cf9e1902e22ed4cd17b6ed344b).
However some RPC handlers are also dealing with port
create/update/delete operations, like dhcp ports for example.
We need to cover these cases too.

Also remove db retry from ml2 plugin delete_port()
as it's not needed once we retry at the API and RPC layers.
(there is already a unit test on this)

The patch also adds a unit test for checking deadlock
handling during port creation at API layer.
Though it's not directly related to the current fix,
I decided to leave it for regression preventing purposes.

Closes-Bug: #1479738
Change-Id: I7793a8f7c37ca542b8bc12372168aaaa0826ac4c

commit_message:
Place rally.conf under virtualenv

Add $virtualenv/etc/rally to paths, where rally
searches its configfile.
Update install script to place configfile under
$virtualenv/etc/rally/ directory.

Now able to install several Rally versions in virtualenves
on the same host.

Change-Id: Idbf3c434c77998f537fc1c11edfb357be6bb1b8c

commit_message:
Remove XML parsing code from magnum.

Openstack no longer supports XML interface for API requests. This
patch removes any stale code for handling xml api.

Change-Id: I7f6cdfdde95d757dfab91fc0c18bb606986e5058
Closes-bug: 1474494

commit_message:
Validate 'is_public' when creating volume type

is_public should be checked when creating volume type, otherwise DBError
will be raised in cinder-api, and the user will receive a 500 Internal
server error.

Change-Id: Id0695fbb05613f3655a7af5b5ab10e08ed5e606b
Closes-bug: #1479170

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-06 10:24:17.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_dvr_db.py', 'neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py'], 'message': "Broadcast service port's arp in DVR

When creating VMs, DVR router will broadcast VM's arp details to all the
l3 agents hosting it. that enable dvr can forwarding networking traffic
in link layer, but when the port is attached to the service liking
lbaas, their arp will not be broadcast, so the dvr do not know its mac,
and will cause that vms in other subnet can not reach the service port
through the dvr router.

Change-Id: Ia78a35f39981d6659fc220e02fb10917bda74e04
Closes-Bug: #1481613
"}]
commit_message:
Broadcast service port's arp in DVR

When creating VMs, DVR router will broadcast VM's arp details to all the
l3 agents hosting it. that enable dvr can forwarding networking traffic
in link layer, but when the port is attached to the service liking
lbaas, their arp will not be broadcast, so the dvr do not know its mac,
and will cause that vms in other subnet can not reach the service port
through the dvr router.

Change-Id: Ia78a35f39981d6659fc220e02fb10917bda74e04
Closes-Bug: #1481613

commit_message:
Capitalize volume status "detaching"

Status displayed for volume in the volume list is not consistent.
Detaching status is not capitalized whereas all other statuses
are capitalized.

Capitalized volume status "detaching" to maintain consistency.

Closes-Bug: #1482167
Change-Id: I995a95bbc6c0c593ad3cd84bb512d0110168aaab

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-10 16:40:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/db/test_migrations.py'], 'message': "Ensure test_models_sync() works with new Alembic releases

test_models_sync() test is currently making assuptions about Alembic,
which might not be true in the upcoming releases: e.g. Column object
will not necessarily be bound to a Table instance.

Fix this by using the format described at:

http://alembic.readthedocs.org/en/rel_0_7/api.html#alembic.autogenerate.compare_metadata

Also, the code has been refactored a bit, so that we don't have to go
over a list of differences multiple times and it's not changed in-place
anymore (removing elements from the list while iterating over it is
error-prone on its own).

Closes-Bug: #1483287

Change-Id: Id0b8a9b7b11ee2cd249176cab403befdd9e06dbd
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure test_models_sync() works with new Alembic releases

test_models_sync() test is currently making assuptions about Alembic,
which might not be true in the upcoming releases: e.g. Column object
will not necessarily be bound to a Table instance.

Fix this by using the format described at:

http://alembic.readthedocs.org/en/rel_0_7/api.html#alembic.autogenerate.compare_metadata

Also, the code has been refactored a bit, so that we don't have to go
over a list of differences multiple times and it's not changed in-place
anymore (removing elements from the list while iterating over it is
error-prone on its own).

Closes-Bug: #1483287

Change-Id: Id0b8a9b7b11ee2cd249176cab403befdd9e06dbd

This was introduced by commit 46608806aa7a9c60214e28429ca5a8b87b2a15de
which didn't take into account that fip namespace name is composed
from external network id rather than router id.
The fix is to ensure fip namespaces for the known routers are kept

Change-Id: I0ffd0a3f6d83f7356638827a1cfe4dabef24b891
"}]
commit_message:
Do not delete fip namespace during l3 dvr agent resync

This was introduced by commit 46608806aa7a9c60214e28429ca5a8b87b2a15de
which didn't take into account that fip namespace name is composed
from external network id rather than router id.
The fix is to ensure fip namespaces for the known routers are kept
by namespace manager on agent resync.

Closes-Bug: #1482521
Change-Id: I0ffd0a3f6d83f7356638827a1cfe4dabef24b891

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-09 23:07:32.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_emc_vmax.py'], 'message': 'Remove bad tests for the VMAX driver

There are a few tests for the VMAX driver that are causing lots of
unit test failures on various patches. I think the reason is several
tests are using the config file with the same name which is created
during setup and deleted at cleanup. When concurrency is > 1, one test
could have deleted the file while another test is trying to read from
it. So the unit tests need to be re-designed to isolate the impact on
each other. This will be worked on. For the short term, I want to
remove the bad tests to reduce the number of unit test failures on
other patches.

Change-Id: Icd0ecf5ed184a81350e25ef0c8df3c3d400def98
'}]
commit_message:
Remove bad tests for the VMAX driver

There are a few tests for the VMAX driver that are causing lots of
unit test failures on various patches. I think the reason is several
tests are using the config file with the same name which is created
during setup and deleted at cleanup. When concurrency is > 1, one test
could have deleted the file while another test is trying to read from
it. So the unit tests need to be re-designed to isolate the impact on
each other. This will be worked on. For the short term, I want to
remove the bad tests to reduce the number of unit test failures on
other patches.

Change-Id: Icd0ecf5ed184a81350e25ef0c8df3c3d400def98

subject: Only install grub if needed
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-10 22:34:20.000000000', 'files': ['elements/vm/finalise.d/51-bootloader'], 'message': 'Only install grub if needed

51_bootloader attempts to install grub regardless of its installed
status, causing errors like:
package grub2-1:2.02-0.16.el7.centos.x86_64 is already installed
By checking first for the binaries, we can wrap the installation
and keep all the useful tuning we do later in this script.

Change-Id: Ib25282c09fe9132e0960101e98b8d804c135a6de
Closes-bug: #1483385
'}]
commit_message:
Only install grub if needed

51_bootloader attempts to install grub regardless of its installed
status, causing errors like:
package grub2-1:2.02-0.16.el7.centos.x86_64 is already installed
By checking first for the binaries, we can wrap the installation
and keep all the useful tuning we do later in this script.

Change-Id: Ib25282c09fe9132e0960101e98b8d804c135a6de
Closes-bug: #1483385

subject: libvirt: proper monitoring of live migration progress
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 128, 'name': 'David Medberry', 'email': 'openstack@medberry.net', 'username': 'med'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 979, 'name': 'Dave Walker', 'email': 'email@daviey.com', 'username': 'davewalker'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 5511, 'name': 'Nikola Dipanov', 'email': 'ndipanov@redhat.com', 'username': 'ndipanov'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7730, 'name': 'Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui', 'email': 'sahid.ferdjaoui@industrialdiscipline.com', 'username': 'sahid'}, {'_account_id': 8412, 'name': 'Mike Durnosvistov', 'email': 'glacierr.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdurnosvistov'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 8992, 'name': 'Billy Olsen', 'email': 'billy.olsen@canonical.com', 'username': 'billy-olsen'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-04-03 23:47:59.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/fakelibvirt.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: proper monitoring of live migration progress

The current live migration code simply invokes migrateToURI
and waits for it to finish, or raise an exception. It considers
all exceptions to mean the live migration aborted and the VM is
still running on the source host. This is totally bogus, as there
are a number of reasons why an error could be raised from the
migrateToURI call. There are at least 5 different scenarios for
what the VM might be doing on source + dest host upon error.
The migration might even still be going on, even if after the
error has occurred.

A more reliable way to deal with this is to actively query
libvirt for the domain job status. This gives an indication
of whether the job is completed, failed or cancelled. Even
with that though, there is a need for a few heuristics to
distinguish some of the possible error scenarios.

This change to do active monitoring of the live migration process
also opens the door for being able to tune live migration on the
fly to adjust max downtime or bandwidth to improve chances of
getting convergence, or to automatically abort it after too much
time has elapsed instead of letting it carry on until the end of
the universe. This change merely records memory transfer progress
and leaves tuning improvements to a later date.

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py
	nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

Conflicts occur do to refactoring changes between juno and kilo.
The libvirt/driver.py module was modified to include the DomainJobInfo
class which exists in the host.py file in kilo, however the entire
file was not needed. Only the necessary changes were ported back.
Fixtures for fakelibvirt were not ported back and was removed from
DomainJobInfoTestCase.

Co-Authored-By: Billy Olsen <billy.olsen@canonical.com>
Closes-bug: #1414065
Change-Id: I6fcbfa31a79c7808c861bb3a84b56bd096882004
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: proper monitoring of live migration progress

The current live migration code simply invokes migrateToURI
and waits for it to finish, or raise an exception. It considers
all exceptions to mean the live migration aborted and the VM is
still running on the source host. This is totally bogus, as there
are a number of reasons why an error could be raised from the
migrateToURI call. There are at least 5 different scenarios for
what the VM might be doing on source + dest host upon error.
The migration might even still be going on, even if after the
error has occurred.

A more reliable way to deal with this is to actively query
libvirt for the domain job status. This gives an indication
of whether the job is completed, failed or cancelled. Even
with that though, there is a need for a few heuristics to
distinguish some of the possible error scenarios.

This change to do active monitoring of the live migration process
also opens the door for being able to tune live migration on the
fly to adjust max downtime or bandwidth to improve chances of
getting convergence, or to automatically abort it after too much
time has elapsed instead of letting it carry on until the end of
the universe. This change merely records memory transfer progress
and leaves tuning improvements to a later date.

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py
	nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

Conflicts occur do to refactoring changes between juno and kilo.
The libvirt/driver.py module was modified to include the DomainJobInfo
class which exists in the host.py file in kilo, however the entire
file was not needed. Only the necessary changes were ported back.
Fixtures for fakelibvirt were not ported back and was removed from
DomainJobInfoTestCase.

Co-Authored-By: Billy Olsen <billy.olsen@canonical.com>
Closes-bug: #1414065
Change-Id: I6fcbfa31a79c7808c861bb3a84b56bd096882004

commit_message:
Fix list comparison for empty list

Replaced boolean expression with 'not fields' in "_filter" method.
Also updated unit test cases which calls "_filter" method with
expected value of fields in restore methods.

The unit test "test_restore_vol_meta" was failing for empty list
because after updating the volume metadata, container was passed
to the "_restore_vol_meta" method where "metadata" is expected.
So fixed this unit test by passing the expected value to the
"_restore_vol_meta" method.

Closes-Bug: 1482619
Change-Id: I95c3a390b0b75c0514a3d63699367081440bf414

On investigation, Manila access calls are non-idempotent.
For this reason, it is vital that we assess the presence
or absence of pre-existing ACLs for any one instance before
calling share.allow(..., ip, ...) Otherwise subsequent
attempts to idempotently verify or add shares to a cluster

Closes-bug: 1481849
'}]
commit_message:
Check ACLs before adding access for Manila share

On investigation, Manila access calls are non-idempotent.
For this reason, it is vital that we assess the presence
or absence of pre-existing ACLs for any one instance before
calling share.allow(..., ip, ...) Otherwise subsequent
attempts to idempotently verify or add shares to a cluster
will fail.

Change-Id: Ib471876f896523856141434b343a743a0f357f84
Closes-bug: 1481849

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-10 08:58:57.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/tests/unit/storage/test_get_connection.py'], 'message': "Make ConnectionRetryTest more reliable

The previous test relied on mocks of retrying.time.sleep. This is
the same sleep as time.sleep so there's a chance, if eventlet is in
context, that something else can call that.

So instead the test now checks to see how many times should_reject
is called. This is the same as the max retries that will be
attempted.

Also the retry wait time has been set to something very small so the
test doesn't hang around sleeping uselessly, making test runs
faster.

Change-Id: Ib15d4d6f8dd23ba534d58005da5dc64aad9e0e90
Closes-Bug: #1482722
"}]
commit_message:
Make ConnectionRetryTest more reliable

The previous test relied on mocks of retrying.time.sleep. This is
the same sleep as time.sleep so there's a chance, if eventlet is in
context, that something else can call that.

So instead the test now checks to see how many times should_reject
is called. This is the same as the max retries that will be
attempted.

Also the retry wait time has been set to something very small so the
test doesn't hang around sleeping uselessly, making test runs
faster.

Change-Id: Ib15d4d6f8dd23ba534d58005da5dc64aad9e0e90
Closes-Bug: #1482722

[{'number': 17, 'created': '2015-07-27 21:42:02.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'nova/crypto.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_crypto.py'], 'message': "Replace openssl calls with cryptography lib

This patch is a code reduction cleanup fix. Exec calls to openssl
can mostly be replaced with a proper python library called
cryptography.

Changed the following:
* Removed convert_from_sshrsa_to_pkcs8 and _to_sequence since
  cryptography already has a method to do this conversion.
* Replaced openssl rsautl call in ssh_encrypt_text and decrypt_text
  with cryptography's public key encrypt and decrypt methods.
* Replaced call to openssl x509 with cryptography's
  load_pem_x509_certificate which also includes a way to retrieve

  cryptography's serialization module. Cryptography supports all

Change-Id: I750b49e6a73cd18af8199c1c859c9f6047252387
"}]
commit_message:
Replace openssl calls with cryptography lib

This patch is a code reduction cleanup fix. Exec calls to openssl
can mostly be replaced with a proper python library called
cryptography.

Changed the following:
* Removed convert_from_sshrsa_to_pkcs8 and _to_sequence since
  cryptography already has a method to do this conversion.
* Replaced openssl rsautl call in ssh_encrypt_text and decrypt_text
  with cryptography's public key encrypt and decrypt methods.
* Replaced call to openssl x509 with cryptography's
  load_pem_x509_certificate which also includes a way to retrieve
  the fingerprint.
* generate_fingerprint's calls to paramiko were replaced with
  cryptography's serialization module. Cryptography supports all
  key sizes of elliptic curve keys whereas paramiko did not.
* Removed the requirement on pyasn1

Change-Id: I750b49e6a73cd18af8199c1c859c9f6047252387

Recently (by Idd5524ed0b602408be5a53830981a8ab974b390c) VPNaaS was
removed from default service set.
But since ec2api supports VPN related features, it needs VPNaaS in
the gating job for functional testing.
This patch adds VPNaaS to jobs which run vpn related tests.

'}]
commit_message:
Add VPNaaS to ec2api Neutron gating jobs

Recently (by Idd5524ed0b602408be5a53830981a8ab974b390c) VPNaaS was
removed from default service set.
But since ec2api supports VPN related features, it needs VPNaaS in
the gating job for functional testing.
This patch adds VPNaaS to jobs which run vpn related tests.

Change-Id: Ia1f5f8747ab82f02c3fae9536c6a91ce84af7833

subject: Remove q-vpn service for DSVM tests
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1, 'name': 'James E. Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 841, 'name': 'Akihiro Motoki', 'email': 'amotoki@gmail.com', 'username': 'amotoki'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 6786, 'name': 'Sergey Lukjanov', 'email': 'me@slukjanov.name', 'username': 'slukjanov'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-01 17:28:31.000000000', 'files': ['features.yaml', 'test-features.sh'], 'message': 'Remove q-vpn service for DSVM tests

There is a DevStack plugin for the neutron-vpnaas repo now, that
enables the q-vpn service. The repo has DSVM based (functional)
tests that use the new plugin and exercise the service.

We now want to remove q-vpn setup from the DevStack repo, and to
rely on the new plugin. To do that, however, we need to make sure
that DSVM tests (other than those in the neutron-vpnaas repo) do
not enable q-vpn, as it will not be set up during stacking (and
q-l3 will not be properly set up if q-vpn is enabled).

This patch, along with I3a4d7ecb25668eb499677d05bdb68b919592e53d
are attempting to remove q-vpn from the list of enabled services.

Change-Id: Idd5524ed0b602408be5a53830981a8ab974b390c
'}]
commit_message:
Remove q-vpn service for DSVM tests

There is a DevStack plugin for the neutron-vpnaas repo now, that
enables the q-vpn service. The repo has DSVM based (functional)
tests that use the new plugin and exercise the service.

We now want to remove q-vpn setup from the DevStack repo, and to
rely on the new plugin. To do that, however, we need to make sure
that DSVM tests (other than those in the neutron-vpnaas repo) do
not enable q-vpn, as it will not be set up during stacking (and
q-l3 will not be properly set up if q-vpn is enabled).

This patch, along with I3a4d7ecb25668eb499677d05bdb68b919592e53d
are attempting to remove q-vpn from the list of enabled services.

Change-Id: Idd5524ed0b602408be5a53830981a8ab974b390c

commit_message:
Fail system tests if no testcases were started with specified group

If a non-existing test group is started, system tests should exit
with non-zero exit code.

Closes-Bug:#1417662

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-08-07 16:16:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'libvirt: check min required qemu/libvirt versions on s390/s390x

The support for running KVM with libvirt on s390/s390x architectures
was documented in the original spec as requiring libvirt >= 1.0.4 and
qemu >= 1.4.0, however, no check was added to the init_host() method
in the libvirt driver. This could lead to users deploying Nova on
unsupported hypervisor platforms. KVM-on-Z developers have indicated
that in fact the min versions can be libvirt 1.2.13 and QEMU 2.3,
so this change adds such a check.

Blueprint: libvirt-kvm-systemz
Change-Id: I2851624a8cdaf353df3386e1e3e3cc0e35af41ec
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: check min required qemu/libvirt versions on s390/s390x

The support for running KVM with libvirt on s390/s390x architectures
was documented in the original spec as requiring libvirt >= 1.0.4 and
qemu >= 1.4.0, however, no check was added to the init_host() method
in the libvirt driver. This could lead to users deploying Nova on
unsupported hypervisor platforms. KVM-on-Z developers have indicated
that in fact the min versions can be libvirt 1.2.13 and QEMU 2.3,
so this change adds such a check.

Blueprint: libvirt-kvm-systemz
Change-Id: I2851624a8cdaf353df3386e1e3e3cc0e35af41ec

commit_message:
Switch to perestroika v5 repositories

Perestroika builds both rpm and deb fuel repos.
We use perestroika rpm repository to build fwm
repository which includes fuel packages as well
as those packages which are listed in requirements-rpm.txt.
Deb repository can be used directly.

Closes-Bug: #1479761
Change-Id: I236144759eb38e71977d175226f81772d23de9b3

commit_message:
ZFSSA driver to return project 'available' space

This fix allows the iSCSI driver to return the 'available' space
property at project level instead of the pool level which is more
accurate in cases when storage is not thin provisioned.

Change-Id: I47ed4ea7a18a479310de01d013e27f84af3eeea4
Closes-Bug: #1479342

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-07 16:59:44.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'move neutron-multinode-full to experimental for nova

The current run time of this test scenario is clocking in close to 1hr
45min, which is nearly twice what the multinode nova testing comes in
at. Anything substantially over an hour should not be in the check
queue, as it holds up critical fixes.

Move to experimental. Once this is regularly coming in closer to an
hour it can come back into check non-voting.

Change-Id: I51ac3bcfbceaa559cf31b2729965d79357858cea
'}]
commit_message:
move neutron-multinode-full to experimental for nova

The current run time of this test scenario is clocking in close to 1hr
45min, which is nearly twice what the multinode nova testing comes in
at. Anything substantially over an hour should not be in the check
queue, as it holds up critical fixes.

Move to experimental. Once this is regularly coming in closer to an
hour it can come back into check non-voting.

Change-Id: I51ac3bcfbceaa559cf31b2729965d79357858cea

To use the implicit ACL file lookup with jeepyb the ACL file name must
match that of the project name (with the added .config suffix). Move the
openstack-user-stories ACL file from user-stories.config to
openstack-user-stories.config so that it lines up and jeepyb can push
the ACLs.

Change-Id: I411e9f9386635c3285be588e194a0c12b8560e04
'}]
commit_message:
Correct name of openstack-user-stories ACL file

To use the implicit ACL file lookup with jeepyb the ACL file name must
match that of the project name (with the added .config suffix). Move the
openstack-user-stories ACL file from user-stories.config to
openstack-user-stories.config so that it lines up and jeepyb can push
the ACLs.

Change-Id: I411e9f9386635c3285be588e194a0c12b8560e04
